name: Allan McConnell
text: We stayed there ONCE and it taught me to never arrive after dark in an unfamiliar campground.  Owner had “held” a pull through site for our 40’ class A with toad.  But, I arrived and that site was filled and office was closed.  I would have gone elsewhere but the camp entrance is not big rig friendly and turning around in the dark is difficult for me.   Got into another back site that was SCARY terraced up a steep incline.  NEVER NEVER AGAIN THERE For me!  Felt like a mountain goat park on the side of a mountain.

name: John Hall (Redneck Romeo)
text: Sunset Bayou is a great place to rest and enjoy a weekend or a wonderful happy place to live. New Laundry Room Ms. Betty provided adds a convenience that most parks do not provide. Sunset Bayou Also accommodates Weddings , Reunions, Birthday party and Events of all sorts.  Clean , safe for children. And how can you resist having the most beautiful of Sunsets in background of your wedding photos or birthday pictures. Maybe you just want a weekend away from the hustle n bustle of life and enjoy fishing. Sunset bayou offers The best of Fishing as the beautiful , lazy Bayou  offers fresh and salt water fish.   Men !  Spend a day with your sons or daughters fishing the bayou.  The bayou feeds into Mobile Bay. Just minutes north of Dauphin Island. The most Amazing Island on the Gulf Coast with a world famous fishing rodeo.  Being this close to the Gulf of Mexico gives Sunset Bayou the salt it needs to carry both fresh and salt species.  Memories that last a lifetime are made here at Sunset Bayou R.V Park..  Hospitality is Amazing. They make it feel like Home. Betty the Owner is as Beautiful a human being , as the Sunsets that rest along her Bayou. You would be blessed to know her.  I know I am. Thank you Little Flower.  I highly recommend Sunset Bayou Water Front R.V Park.

name: Aleta Boudreaux
text: Quiet shaded spots for RVs. Waterfront for fishing from the docks. Kayak launch. Family and Pet friendly. Drug Free. Will allow older RVs in good condition. Grounds and lots kept neat and clean. Under new management. Video security on site.

name: John (Big John)
text: I stayed there for roughly six months and had to leave overnight. In that time it went from quaint little park to nightmare. Gun fire feet from your RV. Inability to be outside without confrontation. Do not go here. It is not a safe place.

name: Erica Lundy
text: DON'T DO IT!!! I stayed there and there are multiple problems. The water is ran off a whale and it has a horrible smell that will make your whole place stink if you turn it on. You can't even take a shower due to the smell. I seen three dogs die including my dog  due to the water. You have to pay for your own power and they tell you it's more than what it says on your meter. Over half of the pictures they show you on the site is not of the RV park. They pay people to leave a good review on the site. If you are a quiet person who likes to stay away from drama and alcoholics, this is not the place to live. Go smell the water and see for yourself if you dare.

name: Mary Deever
text: Awesome place and GREAT owners. Highly recommended by our stay. Hope to make it back next year to see their progress!!!

name: Julia Henderson

Miss Betty is the sweetest lady owner
She was so kind and professional to work with. Her park is well kept and  we are looking forward for our son to live there

text: We have been here for about 3 months now and we love it here. The owner and her daughter are wonderful ladies. They have been very kind, helpful, considerate and understanding. We have met alot of good people out here that we call friends. I would recommend this place to everyone.

name: Shawn Redondo
text:
I start by saying that we didn't spend time there and I didn't ask the price up front.

We spent the night at cathedral caverns and then the lake. On our way home we stopped by to see if there was a dump station that we could use. The lady was very nice and said that they don't have a public dump station but for a small fee we can dump our tanks up front. After dumping the tanks I ask her how much and her response was $40. I couldn't believe that I heard her right, so I asked her again...$40!!!? She responded with yes, where else are you going to dump your tanks.

I'm sorry but stay away from this place if they are going to charge an insane amount for dumping tanks. Thanks for the outstanding service!!!!

name: Edward Vance
text: The owners are amazing, the prices are reasonable and the residents are nice and quiet. The lake and water is across the street, fishing is fun and the pool is nice on a hot summer day! Chris and Penny, the owners take care of the park and know you by name. Highly recommend!

name: SunShine Werner
text: I visit our friend Ricky here often, in the past year have made life long friends and memories w/alot of HH's residents❤️ I'm a single mama & buying a camper is out of my budget right now..BUT, one day I hope to live here. Such a peaceful, awesome place!

name: Jamie Manley
text: My father has lived here for over 3 years and he loves it. Close lake access, friendly people, and the general owners are great.

name: Austin
text: Reasonable prices, great management, and a amazing location.

name: Jim C
text: Welcome to John's Choccolocco Creek Campground.  Nestled at the top of Choccolocco Creek mountain you will find 5 to 6 camping sites with electricity,  water, and sewer hookups and some tent sites. We just setup at site #4 which is well shaded overlooking the valley. You can hear local traffic but still very peaceful and John adds the personal touch everywhere you look and we've only been here 3 hours. Signature 'chicken feed bin' bathrooms with shower, and a washer and dryer available too. All very clean and functional. Drive thru level sites make it easy to setup. This is our 1st try at the Hipcamp app which is how we found this place and this makes it well worth it.  So if you're passing through Alabama,  give John a call and he will be glade to Welcome you.

name: AMY BERGMAN
text: Quiet, tranquil, clean and very unique facilities, laundry on site, creek access, trails, wildlife. Private property owned by great people. Mr. Germany was very accommodating and easy to talk to. Super nice. Full hook-ups, pets welcome, campfires encouraged. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 week stay! This will be our home away from home when we come to the area.

name: David Witney
text: I do not normally do not leave reviews, but I really have to make an exception for this place and the owner John. This is a wonderful place. Comfortable. Beautiful. Clean. Private sites. Bathrooms with showers and hot water. A place to wash cloths for those extended stays. Electric hook ups. Running water at campsites. Firewood for sale or you can go into the wooded trails that he has made and gather your own. And an owner that takes pride in his establishment. It is by far the best campground I have stayed at in the Florida, Alabama and Mississippi areas. It's facilities are definitely unique being made out of silos. A personal touch that I truly enjoyed. John, the owner has done a fantastic job and continues to add his creative touches. My wife and I stayed for a week and loved every minute of it. The area is well located to attractions and things to do. Most being within a 30 minute drive of the state and national parks. We went to Barbers Sotorsports museum which was just an hour away. I could continue to write so much more but not to many people want to read a novel as a review. Let me finish by saying that this place feels like home away from home and John did a great job of making my wife and I fell welcome.

name: K
text: Waisted time and waisted gas!!  Drove out expecting a new campground and it looks like a parking lot. All gravel no grass anywhere. I asked if there was a point was told yes. I got out there and there was not. So if you want something more than a parking lot with no bathrooms or showers this might be a place for you.

text: Awesome new motorcoach resort in south Alabama.  Smaller than some resorts which gives it a more friendly feeling.   Well maintained grounds, clubhouse and pool. Close enough to beautiful Fairhope with a variety of shops, outlet mall, restaurants and golfing.  The gulf coast is just a short drive away.   Always enjoy our stay.

We were on site 38.  The clubhouse and common areas were top notch!!!  Grounds were well maintained.  There is a bit of construction for phase II but it should be completed by the time you read this review.  No pressure to buy a lot but they are a great value being 10 min to Fairhope and 25+/- to the beach at Gulf Shores.
If you are passing thru, it's worth it!  5⭐

There is a club house with wifi, pool table and small library, laundry building, nice pool area, nice large showers at both the club house and club house with large covered BBQ area, boat ramp, large deck, nature trail and a small gazebo on Mifflin Creek, horse shoe pit. The owners who live here are very welcoming.

name: Hope Coburn
text: Owners are unprofessional and VERY unorganized. We had to drill the lock out of a trailer in order to look inside of it. The person that first showed us the trailer was a CHILD! No older than 12! The grandfather that we spoke to after wards said he picks the doors of occupied residents to "check" on them. There is a 50 application fee witch I'm sure is just to get a free 50 bucks because the daughter Lisa who is suppose to be handling the paperwork does not return phone calls or make them for that matter. It was like pulling teeth just to find out if we were approved! Don't waste your time with these people. The park is ran down anyways.

name: Mike “Pirate” Johnson
text: This is a clean, tidy park. More like an overnight spot than a destination. The grounds are well kept and maintained, but offer little in the way of shade or amenities and facilities. It's centrally located in Andalusia, close to shopping, dining, and major roads. Might be a little tight to get in to if you're driving a larger motorhome or pulling a longer 5th wheel. I dont have anything bad to say about the place, but i didnt give it a higher ranking because i didnt see a public restroom on grounds, dog area, playground,  or snack and soda machines.

name: Bridget Williams
text:
This place is very quiet & close to the mill, about 3 mins. The lady Mrs. Vicki is very sweet, she runs it.  Monthly rent is $700.00
Weekly rent is $200.00
Daily rent is &40.00
I hope this helps anyone looking for a spot to put their Rv. Plus they rent campers here already on lots. ( not sure on those prices) They have wifi, 2 washers & 2 dryers. They have a inside bath house and outside bath house.

name: J Diamond
text: The perfect place to be if you want flexibility, privacy, and a nice quite place to stay. All the neighbors look out for each other. Very small Campground but I love it. It's a little tiny community. And the guys rent out the trailers week-to-week are very flexible and very reasonably priced. Pet friendly! There are even outside showers and outside bathrooms that are always clean and cared for. And if somebody moves out of a camper and you want to move into that one because it's nicer, it's so easy to do so! We just did! There's even the sweetest little community dog, that loves everyone, and everyone loves him! VERY HOMIE!

name: Wayne Cox
text: Unless you are in a bad situation i wouldnt stay here, way over priced lady was nice but a good amount of hassle came with staying here..

name: shannon harvey
text: Vicki who runs this is amazing. We came here to work at georgia pacific and we rented one of their rvs. Its a little older but was clean as could be. Everything works. They welcomed my service dogs with open arms. The pavilion here is very nice. Laundry on site with atm and bill changer. Small campground but very quiet. Nobody bothers anybody. I love it here. Hope were here to work for ahwile.

name: J M
text: I was passing through and needed a place to sleep and the manager here was so accommodating. He stayed open late till I arrived and led us to our spot. It was dark so it really helped that he led us, we would have never found it on our own! We only stayed one night but the park seemed nice. Large spots, lots of trees, and a pool.

name: Justin watkins
text: Very spacious and beautiful out here. The owner and his assistant are very friendly and will literally give you the shirts off their backs. They patrol and maintain the area really well and they don't allow party's or riff Raff in the park so it's family friendly here. Every interaction with the owner has been above and beyond our greatest expectations and last but not least, their monthly rates are the highest value we've seen. My wife and my kids and I are so happy here and will definitely return whenever we visit family in Tuscaloosa. Side note we drive a 29 ft motorhome and we had plenty of space.

name: Diana Middleton
text: This is more of secluded privacy kind of stay for long term people. Only down fall is the horrible cell reception I get. I have to keep my phone near the window. They have laundry mat with two washers and two dryers, but they are outdated and sometimes take your money. However you can call them and they’ll give your money back or whatever you lost. I have seen it get out of hand with some other people leaving there. Meaning they were drunk and into it, but since the last couple incident those people have moved out. All the neighbors in my area are very nice and friendly.

name: Wayne Bonner
text: Beautiful people

name: Dougie shields
text:
We lived at this park for several months, and enjoyed it. Mostly great people.
They don't keep the place up real well - grass isn't mowed regularly, and things are getting run down. But it has been a beautiful place.
The pictures aren't all true, though. The ones with mountains in them aren't real! The rest are.
Overall our experience was good.

name: Reba Hughes
text: Dump

name: James K Pitts Sr
text:
Very Nice spacious campsites, plenty of shade. Owner an manager on site at least one of them 24/7...

Disturbances are delt with quickly an quietly,  so you will see those people who have not been able to stay because of there own actions .. putting negative feedback on here...

name: MICHELLE BURNS
text: We enjoyed our overnight stay at the Palomino RV Resort. The young lady at the desk was polite, accomodating, and efficient, given the fact we arrived without reservations. The pull throughs were all reserved so we had to take a back in. Good thing my husband is a pro with back ins. After getting settled we took a walk around the property. This is my favorite type of RV park... concrete pads & paved streets. Nice playground for the kids with good climbing structure. Large fenced area for people with dogs, although I did not see any cool walls for jumping over or tubes to run through. It was just a place to poop. Now the BEST feature was a ninja style splash zone that operates on the weekends. Kids over 6 yrs can play on it for $10/hr, if they have a life jacket. For people who enjoy fishing there's a lake. This is a totally cool RV Resort. (It just needs a play structure for the furry kids.)

text: EXCEPTIONAL!!!  I think this is my 2nd time ever leaving a review for someone and the only reason I am is because it was that wonderful.  Dana has been a true professional lady to work with.  We have watched this place being built for the past 2 years when we come into town and we’re excited to try it out this year.  It was AMAZING!!  very clean, we felt very safe as it’s gated and has security cameras all around.  They have free WiFi that actually works!!!! They went above and beyond with the amenities here.  We will be back every year!!

name: Route 45
text: New full hookup RV park with pull throughs  and back in sites right off of the interstate, clean and lots of amenities if the right time of year (at 23° it was not)! All sites are paved and level, each with a picnic table. Sites have firepits; buddy sites have beautiful brick outdoor fireplaces. There's a playground for the kiddos too. It states there is a glamping area, but I'm not sure if it's an area to remodel vintage campers or what? If hot out be sure to either use sunscreen or use the camper awning as there is no shade as of now. Our host was super nice also!

name: George Dawson
text: really nice park.  cement pads. all very wide. there is a lake to swim in with a beach  opens memorial day.  This is a new park which is owned by the city. it opened up in the fall of 2020. Improvements are still being made.  water psi is very high > 100. Only downside is there are no trees.  would definitely stay here again

name: Kristi Seal
text: The kids and adults loved the Slippery Summit.  We plan on a bigger group going next time.  It was really fun for all of us!

name: Mikaya Huggins
text:
Firstly, this campground is very new with great potential contingent upon establishment 8-10 years from now. It's beautifully planned! Large spaces, nice concrete pads, great layout, wonderful staff, play area, clean ponds/swim area with well thought out and generous landscaping. Clearly a very large budget for this project. I would hands down give those aspects a five star review.

(A little background, we made this reservation after needing to leave the gulf early due to a bad tropical storm and it was the only place that suited the two days between Florida and our KY stay as we made our way home to Northern IL with out three kids under 6.)

As we settled in on our first night, I could not get past the road noise. Big rigs, tuned trucks with loud tires, bad mufflers and drivers with a lead foot made for relentless noise. The kind that you have to raise your voice over or pause your conversations for. Very heavy traffic, even at 8pm. This is the biggest downfall. Their noise barrier will help in the future but it'll be the far future and won't be enough to drown out the constant drone. An entire row of sites is just beyond the road right of way.

Shade- there isn't any for the near future. Fast growing trees are in between each site, but they are young enough to make no difference.

Water pressure is insane. Definitely need a water pressure regulator. If you don't have one, Johnson RV is down the road and it seems they keep those in stock.

The water park with inflatables looks grand! Awesome for older kids but listed, understandably so, for 6 and up. This is where the ball was dropped for kiddos under 6. Our kids so badly wanted to play out there but the beach didn't have enough shallows nor spectacular seeming activities as there are for bigger kids. We will be taking ours to the splash pad we found in town.

We also felt as if it was operated by a couple families. It is not. It is city owned. Which is not a bad aspect, just felt a tad misleading under the name Burrow-Hamilton Farm. It was purchased off an estate with the agreement that there would be public use of a portion of the land, or so I read in an article I found.

We would look elsewhere in the future for something more quaint but this treated us well enough to be north of a tropical storm in between reservations. I was on the fence between two and three stars, mostly because of the road noise and just how close we are to the actual road pavement. Suitable for some, not suitable for others.

name: Dee S
text: Beautiful area. Clean spaces. Full hookups.. We'll definitely put this on our stay list. Owners please send me your email.

name: Stephanie Gilbert
text:
Beautiful, spacious property 5 minutes from town and lots of shops, restaurants. There is lots of room between spots, which are concrete, level, very clean, and come with a fire pit or fireplace, and picnic table. I love their online reservation system, you can even pick your spot! There is a lake, lots of game courts, walking trails, golf cart rentals, general store, firewood, propane, many more amenities. Trash pickup also. Wifi works perfectly and there are spotless bathhouses and laundry (also brand new). The entire property is newly constructed and private, well-maintained and very clean. There are cameras all over so you can feel safe. Great water pressure, too. Very nice people running the place. There are quiet hours so it is very peaceful. Prices are reasonable and definitely worth all the extra amenities.
Be aware that spots 11 & up are somewhat near a road, but it's not very busy and not so close by that it is bothersome at all. I can't say enough good things about this resort. Look forward to returning. If you are in the area definitely check them out!

name: Shawna Finn

name: Elizabeth Fauss
text: We highly recommend this campground! It’s a wonderful very safe place to stop and camp especially if you are doing just one night! It’s quiet and very easy to get to from I-20. It is exactly 1 mile (doesn’t even feel like it’s even that far). It’s behind the storage company. If you don’t turn right on the road after the storage place you will miss it. It’s a tucked away treasure. The spaces are huge, easy to get in and out of and perfectly flat! There is a beautiful tree line and plenty of areas for your pups. Bruce the owner is amazing! He has made the process so simple and easy to book. He is very friendly and down to earth. I cannot praise this place enough!

name: Kathy McCorkle
text: Hidden Gem!  Right off I 20.  Not a resort, it’s well kept, large gravel sites for one night or long term, easy hookups, grass and not one or two, but three, large fenced in, grass dog runs!  Well kept, owner was very helpful, we will definitely back on next cross country trip.  Had a 40ft Class A towing and did not have to unhook.  Wish they could all be this big, neat, easy in and out!  See you next time!

resp.text: We we be here ready for you! So glad you enjoyed your stay!

text: Traveling back home from Tennessee to Texas.  We found this little gem looking for an overnight stop.  It is exactly as it describes. If you are traveling and need a clean,safe place this is it.  Water, sewer,electric (30/50 amp), WiFi, two dog runs and one mile off interstate 20 .  Easy off/on.  Easy in/out.  Large well packed base slots with many pull thru.  Bruce is a great host.  We will be back for sure next trip thru.

resp.text: We'd love to have you back! Safe travels!

They also have a safe area to go to in case of bad weather which made me feel safe   I’m a travel nurse being alone most of the time and I felt secure here. Not far off interstate and close to college and anything you might need. Thanks Bama!!!

text: If you’re looking for a peaceful, well kept park, this is a the ticket! Multiple dog park areas, quiet and away from the main road, and the owner seems to care about every customer. If you’re looking for an overnight stay, football game stay, or extended stay, you can’t go wrong here.

name: Judy Herring
text: We rented a large pull-thru capable of handling a 75ft rig for a night while passing thru. We had adequate room for turning and maneuvering a large rig. Level, gravel site with 50 amps, water and sewer. Lots of choices for food delivery with Waitr was a plus!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review. Glad you found some great food while you were here too!

text: Great overnight stay in a 40 ft Class A towing a Jeep with bikes. Big-rig friendly. Level easy in easy out sites.Can't be be beat for an ovefnight stay. We ard Lifetime Good Samm Members and absolutely recommdnd this Park to all RV'ers.

text: Clean, quiet, friendly and well maintained RV park. Great location during football season, but we stayed there overnight while on our way to Texas. Owner is very friendly and helpful. Location is far enough away from the interstate that you don’t hear trucks and other loud vehicles, but it is close enough to be a convenient overnight stop. We will definitely stay here again.

text:
Quiet place to park the rv. There are a lot of spots, and it was only partially filled during our visit. We were lucky to get a pull through spot at the end. Also lucky enough to be next to the two dog runs.  Bit expensive, but we had full hook ups with electricity and waste right next to the rv so we can just let the hose and wires out.

Staff was great. Even offered us some help if the storm got worse. There was a terrible storm supposed to come in, but it just rained. Still the thought that counts.

Neighbors were also friendly, which is good cause there isnt anything to do here so having a chat while walking the dog or working outside was great

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our 19 acre complex makes for a relaxing location for sure. Please come stay with us any time!

name: Samantha Shaw
text:
Under no circumstances use this camp ground. The owner cut off our water as I was washing dishes and turned off our power. This was not a one time thing and it will damage your camper. We lost all the food in our freezer. He did not knock and would just
come and open the door to the camper and had to keep it locked when I was there. When my husband went to talk to him about it very calmly and ask him to not mess with our camper. The man threatened my husband and got in his personal space. He then ask us to leave after we had paid for a month, due to asking him to not mess with our camper.

The lady at the office was very nice and helpful and did everything in her power to be so kind. She is the only good thing about the campground.

resp.text: We apologize for any misunderstanding that may have occurred during your stay with us.

name: Tammy Moore
text: Stayed here for 4 months and would highly recommend! This is a great place to stay. The owner and employees are very helpful and friendly. The RV park is in a convenient location and is safe and clean. If you need a RV park in Tuscaloosa, this is the place to stay!!

resp.text: Thank you very much! We are happy we could meet your expectations. Come back any time!

name: Patty Boulos
text: clean spots and had a great time

resp.text: Thank you for staying with us! Come on back anytime you need a place to stay!

name: Mandy MW
text: Stayed here for our first trip with a 41ft camper. Online reservations were super easy, the park was well maintained and quiet, the dog parks were clean and had plenty of SHADE! Easy location to find and close to the interstate. Lots of restaurants available for delivery on the Waitr app, too! I’m guessing during football season it’s a bit more full, but we really enjoyed our few days here as a test run!

name: Melody Cook
text: My husband and I have stayed at Bama RV over the past three months. Contrary to a couple of previous reviews, Bama RV certainly does cater to long-term camping! We have a wonderful spot, and even though we have neighbors (which we like!), we have plenty of privacy. We have a dog, so we are very fond of the three different pet areas that are offered. We have full hook up and also Wi-Fi is included in the cost! Bama RV is conveniently located less than a mile from the interstate, and with a quick trip you can reach downtown and The University of Alabama area. It is also only about a 30 minute drive to Birmingham and less if you need to go to MBUSI in Vance. Last but certainly not least, you won’t find better customer service! Denise is the absolute best! From paying your bill, to asking random questions, she goes above and beyond to help in anyway possible! She even gave us a personal phone call when bad weather was approaching to make us aware of the shelter.  Even the owner, Mr. Bruce Taylor, makes the rounds occasionally to make sure everyone is happy and that all is well.  If I could give more than five stars I would!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We sure do take pride in our facility. Our owner, Bruce, makes sure everything is secure and pleasant for our patrons. Come stay with us anytime!!

name: Ed Baldwin
text: This RV park is perfect for our trip. We wanted to be close to the University of Alabama so we could attend our granddaughter soccer camp, and not have to drive 30 minutes or more to get there. We are less than 10 minutes from the campus. We have FHUs, great wifi signal, and adequate room. The only drawback is no restrooms, showers.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our location sets us apart in a lot of situations and we are so happy you could stay with us!

name: James Gest
text: Great place to stay for Alabama football season.  Owners are very friendly and helpful.

text:
Very nice RV Park. The Lady at the front desk was as pleasant as they come. The park is gravel roads and sites. The sites are fairly large and the hookups are very convenient. Had no problem maneuvering my 42’ MH and full size pickup toad. There are train tracks at the back of the park. We never heard a horn the night we were there. I would certainly stay there again.
Steve Riley

The lad on duty in the office was very nice and accommodating. She found a spot that was not being used that allowed us to pull though. We were just staying one night & did not want tonunhook our tie vehicle. So beware, if you need a pull though, don’t go here. Other than that it was fine.

text: We stayed here four months. The people in the park are friendly. The staff is terrific. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks for everything Bama RV !

text: We really enjoyed our stay!  It was a perfect little home away from home.

Overhyped and overpriced. While the service is good they allow no long term rentals and they cater only to football fans . If you want a long term and more affordable RV park hit up sunset or Avalon .

Don't mean to be mean but if you're an rv park you should cater to anyone that is a patron. Not everyone lives and breathes beer and football.

text: Winterhaven is a clean, safe, and QUIET park...it consists primarly of retirees. It is with in walking distance of downtown Fairhope! Parking can be crazy so this is a big plus! There are lots of shops, events, and restarunts nearby! When we stay at the park I enjoy walking around looking at the beautiful old growth oak trees. The management is wonderful and very responsive. I have only encountered friendly neighbors, relaxing days and quiet nights. Wonderful!

name: Steven Ryan
text: Horrible. Some crazy lady came up and just opened the door to our van, angry and asking all sorts of questions like she was delusional. We were just responding to a call to do some cleaning for a tenant there.

resp.text: You were in a van with over 5 young men in the park trying to sell vacuum cleaners at 9:30 at night.  Several of the tenants called the manager and management responded and asked you to leave.  It is a testament to the management that they responded in person as opposed to just calling the police.  Your review is appreciated because it shows that solicitation is not tolerated in the park as well as management’s responsiveness to the calls and complaints of the residents.

If you are looking for a mobile home park with newly paved roads where people drive fast then we may not be for you.

name: Kim Sanders
text: We are 100% satisfied with the service we received from McCaig & Griffin employees.  We love our new home in Blue Eye Water Front Community. You have an awesome team of people who are great at their jobs and go out of their way to accommodate no matter what the situation is.  They all deserve a big raise.    We love living here and being a part of the  community. We love living on the water and are enjoying our beautiful lot.  This community has come  a long way since we first moved in.   We are impressed with the changes and are  excited to see more changes that will come.  If you want a beautiful lot for home or R.V.,  on land or water this is a great place to be.....Jerry and Kim Sanders

name: Marylou King
text: The park is not a destination park.  It's good for an overnighter if you are self contained.  There is only unisex bathroom with a toilet, sink, and shower.  All the sites have 50 amp, fortunately, my husband has the proper connectors to go from a 50 amp to a 30 amp.  There is only one pull through spot, which we had and need as we were pulling our car.  It's also near the highway and I was hoping once it got late traffic would stop, but no such luck.  The people in the store that check you in are really nice and the best part is it is on the cusp of Eufaula Wildlife Refuge. The RV campground has fencing around it to protect campers from the alligators that roam.

name: John Ward
text: Nice quiet wonderful place to boat, camp, fish and spend time with family!

name: John Bryan
text: Osprey RV park is a hidden gem. The people are super friendly and the price is right. The location is perfect for fishing, as it is only a minute from the state park ramp. It has plenty of nice sites, all of which are level. It has water and sewer. The only down sides are ants and no concrete pads.

name: David Rose
text: Nice small park, don't worry about reserving your spot. You won't get it anyways. You'll just pick a spot when you get there.

name: Lynette Mosley
text: This is a decent place. I don't know about long term but for passing thru...excellent.And a bonus are the Ospreys and the gators. So cool. The girls who waited on us were real nice and personable. Nice laundry area.

name: Lyssa
text: Stopped for a night passing thru. Was nice, friendly workers.

name: Jamie Smith
text:
We found this Rv Park by luck & my wife and I are so glad we did. When my employer sent me to Eufaula I was less than happy,  because it being a small town I thought the Campgrounds and RV parks were few and limited to amenities. After calling the owner on our drive up I was told the rv Park was open and to “ come on”, I forgot to mention it would be close to 11p.m when we got there but when I arrived I found 3 after hours numbers to call and it was answered on the first ring. I was told to pick any spot I wanted and to come see them the next day. When we found our spot we backed our 40’ fifth wheel in and was happy to see the spots were very level ! The next day after work I went to pay for our week here and met “Joe” the owner of the park , he was so kind and friendly and told us if there was anything we needed to let him know and he would do what he could to make it happen. So after a few days here I noticed the sewer hookup was above our sewer hose and sewer hose supports, after telling Joe within a week his son had came and fixed every sewer hookup at the park! I was originally only staying a week but after meeting Joe and his sons Chris and Wes and feeling so at home I have been here a month, &  hate that we have to leave for another job.
It’s a brand new Rv Park with full hookups and really good WiFi that hasn’t lagged or buffered once! If your traveling through Eufaula Al and need a place to stop this is a great place, and some of the best owners I’ve ever had to deal with! So glad I found this hidden gem!

name: Kelly
text: Nice park, friendly owners! Great place for long term stays!

text: Do not go there!! It is a tiny resident campground. Big holes,no drive through spots.  I dont know how they have a 4.6 rating

name: Ruben Moralez
text: Stayed here a couple of months, and it was a good place to stay, quiet and close to Athens and stores. The owner is doing  some upgrades and adding more lots so that’s a plus, more people to add to a good place. There are some long term tenants and you can tell by the amount of stuff they have outside. Friendly people everyone minds their business. If you’re down the hill you’ll have low cell phone service, only downfall I could say about this place is that. But the owner can help you get hooked up to some internet just talk to him. Good water pressure and clean lots. If I’m in the area again I’d definitely stay again.

text: Great place to stay!  Owners are real friendly.  Quite at night time.  Loved how close this place is to Cherokee Rock Village.  Def will be coming back to this campground.

resp.text: Hi Rodney,  thanks for the 5 star review. We appreciate your support. Joy Johnson 🙂

name: Robin Wagstaff
text: We stayed at Joyland for 2 weeks last summer and had a fabulous time.  Bob and Joy are the most gracious hosts and we had great conversations, grilled out together and enjoyed their delicious wine from their own vineyard!  The RV park has a fishing lake and is connected to Lake Weiss which we were able to explore with our kayak.  Cherokee Rock Village is nearby along with Little River Canyon in Fort Payne for nature lovers and motorcycle enthusiasts. The facilities are first rate and Bob and Joy took care of our every need.  Please go support this wonderful RV Park and relax and enjoy yourself!

resp.text:
Robin Wagstaff, you and your beautiful wife were one of the most wonderful guest here at Joyland. We appreciate your support and your awesome work you did with the videos of Joyland RV Park 😊. You guys did a great job.
Thank you😃

name: Brenda Cardwell
text: My name is Tommy Cardwell I've known Bob Johnson for around 25 years My wife and I along with my two brothers and sister in law just spent the weekend at the bed and breakfast and let me tell you it was beautiful and clean great place to fish and just relax and Bob and his wife Joy treat you like family and once you stay there you become family two of the nicest people you would ever want to meet its a beautiful RV park about 11to 15 acres beautiful place to go if you want to just do some R&R this is a 5 star rating my finger hit the wrong one

resp.text: Thank you Tommy for the 5 star review 😃

We feel safe and secure here and having that is worth everything in this world of hate.

name: Sal Biasiucci
text: Its a Nice Camp Ground on the Lake and we can Dock our Boat While we're  There

name: Dinah Rodgers
text: The owners are very friendly and helpful! The people who live here year round are rude. And there was someone in the RV park nextdoor to the camp ground that pulled a gun on people who ask them to slow their boat down so they wouldn’t damage the boats in the Marina.

name: Edward Gullo
text:
Dale B moved in and paid 1 months rent. It took me 3 months of non payment to kick her out and a full week to clean up her trash. The court ruled in my favor.
Jimmy E, a neighbor, tried to commit suicide by shooting himself and failed. A few weeks later, he pulled a knife on me an wanted me to shoot him to finish what he couldn't do. He lost his job and was told never to come back.
Alfred, 'Hank' moved in my 2 friends apartment. After only a couple weeks he had a restraining order put on him  and charged with terroristic threats.
I have been here for over 10 years. As everyone who deals with the public knows, you run into people that just likes to start trouble. I've worked with the public since I was a teenager so I've learned to take the good with the bad.

name: Brett Wyte
text: Stary away from this place no insurance the sewer is running wild the owner is a real nut job he lies try to play the good guy it's fake he allso walks around at night close to your windows late at nite

name: Mindy Broom
text: It has potential but very crowded, if the number of campers were smaller and a bit of landscaping this would be the place to be during the summer months.

name: tn4me 123
text: Horrible place. It is in his backyard. So much junk, old wood, mattresses around. Campers there were from the 80's. Nothing was kept up. Scary place.

name: Tim Smith
text: Did not get to stay here cause of family  emergency . Took our money. This is not how u do  Business . We  canceled a week in advance . The owner never said anything about a  cancellation policy as a matter of a fact said he would hold our check until we came did not do that cashed our check took our money what a POS this man is a crook do not go here. The place looks like a  meth head haven . Stay here at ur on risk

name: Odizzle Elz zido
text: Lake experience is here.

name: Alfred Harding
text: Edward Gullo is a wicked lying thief who stole my stuff and sold it and come a time and place he will pay dearly for his greedy deeds

name: Grayson Love
text: Very rude people, not recomenabl

name: sl smith
text: Nice place

name: Jeffery Bates
text: Big fishing

name: Mitchel Wood
text: Close to the water

name: Samantha Cambron
text: Lovely place!!!!!!!!!

name: ddkeil
text:
So much for Friendly and Inviting. When I called the lady that answered the phone acted like I was interrupting her. She asked what I needed and I told her I was looking to move down there around February and was looking for an RV spot until I could get a place to buy or rent. She said she was not sure if she could make me a reservation or not and then asked how many people and I told her just me and my dog. She immediately asked how big my dog is and told her he is a Min Pin and Corgi cross. She said that was to large of a dog and they only allow small dogs. My dog is well behaved and loved by everyone that meets him and he is a small dog. She said he is too big and that she could not help me.

Not sure if it was really the dog or just the immediate feeling I got of not being wanted there to start with. Either way, I did not get the friendly and inviting feeling from the start of the conversation. Bad part is, I fell in love with the place from the pictures and the reviews talking about how nice and quite it is and the fact that they like to keep rift raft and young noisy partiers out. I like quite and I stick to myself and this place seemed perfect for me, but I guess it was not meant to be.

name: Carol Holloway
text: Very personable. Friendly and affordable.

name: FreakyFast4
text:
We stayed 1 week!
Had 0 issues!
The concrete plant next door didn't bother us at all with our ac running.
Highly recommend for travlers or staying for a while!
5 stars in my book.
Also caught alot of blue gill in lake and released.
Great place to stay!

name: Greg Wilson
text: Great RV Park nice and clean and the owners are very good people

name: philip hanley
text: beautifully arranged park with a lake view for all campers. Caught some tasty Bluegill from the lake. The shower house is spic & span as well as heated... perfect!

name: brian clifton
text: Very affordable and the couple that runs it are very sweet, so far so good. Nothing fancy but clean and has all the things you need.

name: Adam Hawk
text: Worst rv park ever. If u have kids or like to have any fun do not stay here. I respect a retirement village but if that's what is then let people know from the get go.

resp.text: Unfortunately Mr. Hawk and his crew of numerous adolescents were asked to leave as they were wrecking the bath  house and speeding around the park. So I Think he is a wee bit bitter.

name: Christian Ringer
text: I love the environment! The management are also very well intended people, I haven't met them personally although you can tell by how they maintain everything and how inviting the place truly does seem. In terms of maintenance, I couldn't be happier. The pond is stocked well with fish, the wash houses are very clean and inviting, the grass is kept clean cut and beautiful. Over all the place is just clean. To elaborate on the inviting nature of the park, the name says it all. Gulf shores is a wonderful vacation town and I highly recommend staying here if you decide to visit. God bless

name: Carla Vanetten
text: This is a beautiful little campground and close to the beaches , shopping , and dining. It's  very well maintained  and pet friendly. The owners are very nice and make you feel welcome. Although there is a concrete plant next door , you adjust to it quickly. All of the amenities, such as  Wifi, Cable , and laundry  room make  up for a little  noise. I can't  wait  to go back .

name: tracy thompson
text:
Loved are time at Lazy Lake Rv... Felt like being home. Very clean grounds , laundry and bathe house.
Owners are amazing in solving any issues that may arise.
If you need a quiet place to camp close to all the tourist sights and only a few miles from the beach this is the place to be ! A diamond tucked away from it all yet close too. The best of both worlds .... Will definitely recommend !!

name: Melvetta Swick
text: I can't get the owner to  answer the phone or call back.   Would like to stay there.

name: Christopher Bowler
text: On site facilities need help. Bathroom/shower is like an oven even at nightime. Washer/dryers outdated and did not work. Why is there a lake, you can't use it?  Roads are pretty awful as well. They say don't park in the grass, but there is nowhere else to park.

name: Nonjula Maddox
text: I can not say enough good things about this place. They have large spacious lots with a very nice lake for fishing.  The owners are extremely pleasant. Some complain about the noise from the concrete plant next door but we didn't hear it at all.  It is close to so many shop & restaurants with a short drive to the beach. Thank u so much for the southern hospitality. We had a blast and will definitely be back.

name: annnie oakley
text: great people, beautiful environment. the concrete company provided background noise, but was not an issue or offensive to me. the prices are the best in town and the location is convenient to the beaches and shopping.  camped in a small motor home and can't wait to go back.

name: Anna
text: This is our second season here and we have enjoyed it even more this year. The couple that runs this are very nice and  hospitable. The grounds are clean and well-maintained. It is areal family campground - rural - yet close to all the amenities. We will be back

name: Chris A
text: Just hung up phone with them. The have photos of play area and fishing but only allow 2 adults and small dog. No children allowed. She said they are a "liability hazard".

name: first last
text:
This is hard because the place is great. Large well kept lots, good rates, nice big inexpensive laundry room, good wifi, NO highway noise, good location, beautiful lake which is likely why they don’t want small children staying, do you want your child to drown? No.
But that concrete plant starts at 5:30am, one day they started at 3:30am! 7am on Saturday. I have a new respect for concrete workers.
When my husband made the reservation, they did tell him about the plant and said he could select better WiFi or less noise. He selected better WiFi. The noise didn’t bother my husband but he could probably sleep in the middle of the Super Bowl.

name: kitt katti
text: This actually is a very cute little campground. The sites are large enough to accommodate any size rig.  There is a cute little lake and every site has a view. The wi-fi is awesome. The reason I gave it two stars is the NOISE.  Yes, it is off the beaten path and close to everything, but it is next to a CONCRETE PLANT that starts at 5:30 in the morning, seven days a week.  The owners are very nice, but I think they could have told us when we made the reservation for a month with no refund that this might be an issue.  Instead when I checked in, she mentioned it.  We are taking a loss and moving elsewhere.

name: Jerry Watson
text: Stayed there for the last several October's, and plan to stay many more, another park said my RV was to old, doesn't matter I have spent  over hundred thousand on up grades, I love this place, I'm older so the concrete plant working at 6 am, while I have my coffee reminds me I'm on vacation. I feel safe and welcome here.

name: Carl Nethery
text:
The owners were very nice, but that is all I can say nice about the RV Park
Most of the spaces are sand & gravel & alot of Fire Ants ( so beware). The only thing to do there is to fish.  But if you wanted peace & quiet this is NOT for you as there is a Cement Factory beside the Park.  It starts operation at 5:30 in the morning & goes all day.  The only day they do not work is Sunday. (Yeh peace & quiet for one day).
To bad because if a small park & fishing is for you this would be perfect.  If you like to get up at 5:30 & will be gone all day I guess this would be for you.
Also you would think the price would be lower than the other nicer RV parks but it is not.   It was NOT a very nice experience.   I will read reviews from now on.

name: john carter
text: I didnt go here I just drove by , but it looks cozy

name: Terry Lockhart
text: Very peaceful and clean except for sometimes concrete plant can be a little noisy.  The owners are very kind and helpful.

name: Bye bye Buckwheat
text: I used to live here.. LOVE Mr. Johnson!

name: Mark Rickey
text:
Nice large spaces.good wifi. Terrible noise from the concrete plant just next door. They start at 5:30am & don't stop till 4:30 mon.-sat.
Impossible to sleep or talk outside during those hours. Spaces along the plants fence should get a discount.

name: Anne Stewart
text: It is ok. People don't pick up behind their dogs and she doesn't want me to use my washing machine because of a not good septic system.

name: frank thornton
text: Only issue is a plant next door. They start work early. It is loud!

name: Christa Burton
text: Visited our friends from KY who now live at Lazy Lake. Beautiful park and close to everything!

name: Tommy Pate
text: Great place to park your rv

name: Vicki Kennedy
text: Great place to call home

name: Charles Lockhart
text: Comfortable and peaceful place for RV stay.

name: Jennifer Johnson
text: So nice great for children and hiking

name: Steve Hosier
text: Very nice campground.

name: Diana Muckelroy
text: My mother always told me if you couldn't say anything nice don't say anything at all.

name: Ervin Adkins
text: Small, laid back, quiet

name: Stacey Cryer
text: Turtles come to you

name: John Bryan
text:
This is a good place to stay on this side of the lake.  It is super close to the boat ramp and has full hook-ups.
The downsides are, they have full time residents that live here. That wouldn't be so bad but everyone of them don't have mufflers on there cars. So all night and day you hear them crank up and leave and come back to the park. And they do it really frequently which I find really strange.
I would definitely stay here again though.

name: Rachel Bergere
text: We stayed at Lake Jordan RV Resort for 2 months in our motorhome as we were buying a house in Wetumpka. The park and fellow RV neighbors were quiet and the grounds were kept up nicely. There is a short, cute boardwalk that takes you down to the lake. There are two docks to moor boats and my kids loved swimming in the lake everyday. It is a great spot for fishing and kayaking/canoeing. And the Bonner's Point boat launch is within walking distance. I enjoyed taking walks next to the lake and through the quiet country neighborhood daily. It is also a close drive to a grocery store and restaurants in Holtville (or as the locals call it Slapout). The surrounding country is pretty and it is a short distance from Wetumpka. There is a laundry but no bathhouse, so you need to be self contained. Full hook ups and 50 amp power worked well! We would recommend this park.

name: Rankin Rouse
text: Full hookups with quick access to lake is only plus.  Full time residents and a lot of noise all night.  DON'T LEAVE YOUR BOAT IN THE MARINA OVERNIGHT!.  Mine was robbed of trolling motor and radio.  Owner didn't care.  3 other boats of full time residents beside mine wasn't touched, so pretty sure was local job.

name: Brandon Hammock
text: Very nice and caring people!!! Will do anything to help you out or fix anything that's wrong!!! I'll give them 5 star rating everyday if I could

name: Monica Flux
text: Very pleased with our stay here for two nights. Clean, quiet and relaxed. Laundry facilities very clean and inexpensive. When visiting family in the area we will definitely stay again.

name: Dora Rieves
text: Did not stay at the RV park, however, the owner is extremely nice and easy to work with. We made a reservation and had to cancel. She did not run our CC in case we didn’t make it in. When we called to canceled, she was very nice and considerate.

name: Tonya Granger
text: Quite lil place.. enjoyed my time here

name: Emily Andres
text: Mosquito ridden.  Good otherwise.  No trees at this point.  Seems newer.  Did have laundry, no bath house. Highway noise.

name: Jesse Windham
text: Great place

name: cory roberson
text:
Our names are Cory and Angel. Angel will be reviewing because she spends the most time at the campgrounds.
I have been waiting to start reviewing some campgrounds we have stayed in. I was waiting so I would have a few to compare against. We have now stayed in 12(some more than once) since June 2019.
First about us, my fiancé is a pipe welder and we live in our RV full time traveling from job to job. We moved into the RV fulltime in June 2019.
We are currently in this campground and will be leaving Friday May 1st,2020. Moved camper here to work at GP plant that's less than 2 miles away. And just found out we need to move to Chickasaw for another job.
Laundry is nice. Campground was just sold so we didn't meet the new owners. Previous owner is very sweet. I'm not sure what the new owners will do but currently there is no one here to pay. She runs a place of business a few miles down the road and comes in the afternoon to get payment after you setup. Park is very clean. Had some issues with ants but its been raining a lot so that's understandable. The line of sites where we got on aren't really level but we picked it because its closest to the woods and away from most campers. We would certainly return here.
Weekly rates are $156 with tax.
Our stay was April 24th - May 1st, 2020

name: Howard Randall
text: Great RV camp.

name: Bridget Williams
text: Very nice owners, and clean , quite campground with washers and dryers.

name: Mike Barker
text: What can I say about this park that's different from the others .I have yet to be at a RV park in the south .Every one I have been to the staff is friendly and ready to help you how ever they can .great amanaties including bathhouse and on site laundry .

name: charlotte wiley
text: Very nice campground! We stayed for the Blueberry festival in June!  Very clean, very curtious!  Just needs a few trees!!  Deserves 5 stars!!

name: Brando McLeod
text: Clean and safe. Camp host are nice and accomidating.

name: Jay Howard
text: Super nice owners, clean park, three washers and dryers for this size of a please

name: Mr Yutt
text: Nice basic Campground.  Occasionally there is a bad smell coming from the near by sewage treatment plant.

resp.text: Thank you for staying with us. The odor was from the paper mill. Mostly the wind comes out of the west, but unfortunately we get some odor when the wind comes out of the South and the humidity is high.  We hope to see you again.

name: Cheryl Sullivan
text: We stayed almost a year. It Hadden been opened very long when we first got here. The new owners are great, very friendly and keep the park clean. Every spot has a grassy spot. Plenty  of room in between rvs. Very quit n friendly place. It feels like home away from home. We've made plenty of friends around the rv park. There is always someone walking or walking there dog. My 2 year old rode her little jeep or tri cycle around the park. We also rode our golf cart. You feel safe and around family here..There is everything you need just mins away from grocery stores, shopping all kinds of activites.  Great places to eat out. A must is davids catfish house..There is a bunch of little towns around to explore. I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: George Elder Sr
text: Nit a good experience there.  Much to be desired.

name: D.B. Haddix
text: Stayed 6 weeks. Great location and nice sites.

name: Charles Schrock
text: Never been there

name: Al Sorrenti
text: Great place, very quite.

name: Jeff Cornelius
text: Nice intimate, quiet camp, stayed over the winter and will stay again. Good facilities, great proximity to shopping, dining and activities. Owner and caretaker showed the meaning of Southern hospitality.

name: Zachary Nowell
text: Quaint Rv park me and my wife and our 3 dogs stayed here for the weekend was quiet and nice hope to come back soon when visiting family. The spots are rock and are hard so no sinking in the host is very friendly and nice and goes out of his way to make sure you are comfortable through your stay! His name is Tom. Very nicely shaded as well to help the rv stay cool in that summer weather and far enough away from the highway you dont get that traffic noise.

name: John Baker
text: A new up and coming rv park. Small but pretty and quiet. Laundry,wi_fi full hook up and personable friendly manager by the name of Tom

name: Michelle Amich
text: We were warmly greeted by the manager when we arrived. There is ample room to turn your rig around so that you can back in at your preferred angle. Amenities were easy to hook up to. We also had good Wi-Fi signal. We felt the area was nice and quiet in the evening.

name: Douglas Sherman
text: Fantastic harvest host RV Park. Full hookups including trash disposal, outdoor games and laundry facilities. Twenty dollars we'll spent!

name: Chad Goodwin
text: Great small RV park outside of Dothan, AL. Tom was very nice and helpful!  WiFi was great!  We streamed a movie the night we stayed there.

name: Susan Kiddy
text: Nice country setting, reasonable pricing and you can't get any better folks. New park, with ongoing plans for future. Close to Dothan shopping!

name: Suzanne Roquemore
text: Nice, convenient little campground near Dothan.

name: Cynthia Tindal
text: No longer Keller Rd. Tindal & Young Ret. RV Park. New management. Seniors park, small dogs only.

name: Sarina Melendez
text: Extremely trashy! The creature that runs this place (very poorly)  is atrocious! She is known to go around and harass tenants daily, change rates and add on charges for the most ridiculous things. She physically attacked my husband. She gossips about tenants to other tenants. Save yourself the headache and stress and find somewhere else. I promise you will be glad you did!

name: Elaine Parker
text: Ms. Cindy has cleaned this place up!! We have had our Rv there for the past 6 months and very happy.

name: Whuchie Boss
text: Fix the roads

name: S Jones
text: Don’t even think of staying here.  The power is absent, or at least unknown.  Several boxes were duct taped shut and when we asked the onsite person, he said "just plug in and see if it works."  This is a very crowded, un-level, and un-kept place.

name: Robert Martin
text:
If one were to need a place to live where the landlord/nazi creates an environment of chaos and discontent this is it. Our experiences here were horrible at best. Cyndi Tindal and her lawnmower are constantly riding around your lot searching for reasons to evict those that she in her alcohol induced stupor have violated her ever changing rules. She verbally and physically assaults her tenants, charges fees that are unlawful, and consistently violates federal postal laws. During the time that we have left her property she has threatened to evict multiple families because she "saw" us in her hell on earth.  Even though we haven't been there. Her idea of a rv park includes charging for power washing your camper, cutting your sewer lines, going through your mail, and spreading vicious rumors and lies about other tenants while being "nice" to you. In the year that she has assumed ownership of the property she has lost her grip on her sanity. We pray that you read this before staying here. Pay the extra money and keep driving to a different rv park.
I have learned that Cindy Tindal conspires with demons. Was informed recently that Capt John passed away.  He died in his camper after the ambulance was called they were going to do their job and Cindy told them to slow down because this is not a race track... I am at a loss for words over her behavior STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE .

name: Exotic Butterz
text: Constantly changing their rates, they allow dogs to poop wherever and don't clean it up.  Dumpster is always full and stinks.  The Lady who runs the place curses like a sailor and walks around drunk all the time.

name: Betsy Johnson
text: Apiece of heaven on earth !! I'm Blessed... Xoxoxo Betsy

name: T Butler
text: Owner is very rude, nosey and curses like a sailor to be a woman.

name: Kim Deal
text: Lived here for many years. The lots are fenced in, mailboxes are keyed, very quiet little park. Small pets are allowed, the owned is very nice, firm rules for a reason. Overall, its a great place to live.

name: Eric Miller (SPYDER)
text: Staff and owner are great people and were nice to get to know, BUT, if u got kids, KNOW THIS, there ARE some creepers in the neighborhood, better be careful who u let ur kids associate with

name: Dana Spurlin
text: Just moved in, no problems.  It's really quiet.  I love the small , fenced in lots.  The owners is really nice.

name: Lisa Bonner
text: It is very private and safe. The owner is wonderful, firm, but fair. The upkeep is top notch. Love living here.

name: Melva Thomas
text: I was lost.

name: Scott Murphy
text: Older too small, cramped

name: Anthony Brown
text: It is a trailer park..

name: billy chapman
text: Trailer park has lock boxes. Landlord lives on site. Trailers rented by outside sources. Dogs are allowed here and each home has a fenced in yard. Unsure about price.

name: Ronnie Robinson
text: This campground is my favorite place to go camping.  The owners have worked so hard to make this a fun relaxing place to go.  Grounds are exceptionally kept and they offer full hookups on every lot for your RV.  Everyone is always friendly and easy to talk to.  Pool and clubhouse are very nice and we maintain.  Pot luck dinners on Saturday night.  You guys have a great campground.  Thanks for all you do to make it the perfect camping getaway for me

name: Delton Scroggs
text:
We spent the weekend it is very nice secluded camp, the staff could not have been nicer. I have stayed at many campgrounds and this one is one of the best.
They have a very nice going for, nice outdoor area, and the camper/RV sites are well done,  good power, good water and sewer. It is not a big party camp and the crowd was much more quiet and Saturday night potluck was a joy.
We will definitely be going back again.

name: Tyler Bardes
text: The guys here are the best . we are members at other campgrounds like this and this one is the best in our opinion. Everyone is very friendly including the regulars . they went out of their way to help us in a time of need running from hurricane Irma. . I highly recommend this place to anyone in the community . we will definitely be back multiple times .. Thank you Guys for everything you did !!!!!

resp.text: Tyler, thank you, Rick and Rick for coming into our family. Your kindness and laughter is a gift to us! Big love to you all.

name: Cesale Hunter
text: Absolutely love coming here! The campground is beautiful and clean! Gregg, Les, and Danny are such wonderful people! I cannot wait to go back!!

name: David Berry
text: A very nice little place to visit. Greg and Les are always willing to show their hospitality and insure that your stay is a wonderful experience. Very nice pool, Great hospitality, and fun fellowship, what more can you ask for?  5 STARS!

name: Nick Stronz
text: Like a home away from home. Greg and Dan are very welcoming and kind. The camp and pool are clean, private, beautiful, and not to mention you're treated with utmost respect. Surely will return!

name: Campin Kayak
text: 11 Acres of which half is protected Indian Mound.  No room to run a dog. Highlight is to drink and smoke stuff on the porch.  Not my idea of campground.

name: Leonard Smith
text:
Lizard Landing is ran by despicable people. They are usually drunk by 9 am. They are so greedy for money, they think the campers are ignorant and do not know how to read the electric meters. Double charged for electricity month one. The next month, was gone for 1/2 the month, the electric bill was more than the prior month. Even with photos of the meter, the low life's tried to argue.

They have no morals. Go through the mail, delivered the packages they wanted too. Kept the ones they did not.

Sickening scum. Should be called carp landing campground.

resp.text:
Normally I wouldn't respond to a scam artist THIEF, but in this case I feel that I must. I was certain that with your superior intellect and education that you would at least be able to follow basic rules of spelling and punctuation "Doctor Benjamin Nathaniel Roger Benjamin Leonard Smith/Bullard/Lewis"  (with Domestic Violence charges on your record, and now Theft of Services in Alabama)

Let's start with grammar shall we? Lizard Landing is RUN....not "ran"...."Low Life's" doesn't require an apostrophe. ...if you weren't "cooking" in your camper your electric rates probably wouldn't have been so high. Let's see....in the 8 weeks that you were here, supposedly ALL of your bank accounts were "hacked", things that you never even owned were supposedly stolen, your rotator cuff was damaged horribly which MIRACULOUSLY healed with the speed of an Angel on Crack, The Monsters from Ford Motor Credit were after you for your car (which was reported stolen in March) your HUSBAND Ronald D. Bullard had supposedly declared you dead to collect on your life-insurance.....

PLEASE, you twisted, demented, low-life, bottom feeding pond scum little wench, you are a scam artist, a liar, a thief, and a fraud...your trail of deceit is closing in on you and you know it....it must really suck to be you.

name: Chauncey Hart
text:
I have been camping for years, and i have been to many camp grounds, but this one really set it's self above everyone. As soon as I got there The owners made me feel very welcome. Gregg made sure I had a really good spot to set up my tent. After I got all settled in, I walked up the club house and was introduced to some of the other campers. No one was rude, or made me feel like i was a outsider. Everyone at the camp group visitor and owners alike made me feel like for the first time in my life I could be myself and have fun.
The weather was wonderful as well, even though the first day was rainy it was still very pleasant and the rain helped you sleep well. The sun  and the breezes made beginning and the pool just the place to go. If you didn't want to be by the pool you could sit ob the deck  and just chill out. I opted for beginning pool side and had a great time even though i got myself sun burned. NO amount of spf can help if you sit out in the sun to long. The pool its self was great. I had never been in  salt water pool and I loved it. It was just cool enough to help against the heat but warm enough to enjoy it  anytime day or night.
The location was awesome, i need to get some things from the little of Columbia  AL near buy and it was very nice . The people and shop owners were all very  friendly.  They told me about different things in the area and where honestly nice. I couldn't find a fake smile from a single one. I even heard a couple of good jokes from one of the ladies from the gas station i visited . It isn't far from the Florida state line and only a couple of hours from Panama city and the beach which was great fun even in the off time i was there. I got a couple of eye sore shirts and enjoyed the beach to some degree.
But there was a couple of a draw backs to my time there. One my cell phone didn't really work at the camp site (Thanks t-mobile I will be dropping you as soon as I can!). The supervisor cats really didn't seem to like dog guest  the much. (even thought I loved petting every one of them.)
But over all I loved this camp ground and i am working on my next trip to go down as soon as i can.

name: robert biston
text: herd from a lot of my friends in the atlantic fly zone that a lot of feathers wasa flying up there. they all stopped by and had a big grin on there bills one even flew in with a pair of bloomers! good luck from all the critters at BOBOS barnyard.

name: Pop's Garage
text: Great little Gay clothing optional campground, with great people and no drama

name: Chris Berglund
text: Great guys that run this campground.

name: Breundra Anneice Johnson
text: Very quaint place

name: David Fussell
text: Clothing optional

name: cubby robison
text: Love the pool and deck.

resp.text: Thank you both so much for spending your time with us, it was a pleasure to meet you!

name: Southern Gypsy Pickers and off road
text:
It's very relaxing to sit next to the creek. They have a playground. Full hook ups for 30/50 amp.
The sewer is in the front of the camp sites. So be prepared for extra sewer hose. We will be going back to make more memories.

name: Walter Geiger
text: Kind of don't want to share this place because, I want to go back and not be told no vacancy. You can reserve and pay online. The amenities of a hot shower and clean restrooms complete the cold creek and not having do the deed in the forest. Has water and electrical hook up and still allows tents during the "Covid Pandemic," you can walk the trail along the creek to keep you "social distancing."

name: Brian White
text:
Nice, small, simple campground. Cool creek for swimming, chair sitting and relaxing.
Side note: We made reservations in advance and hurricane Sally came through and wrecked our plans for camping the following weekend. I was not going to ask for a refund. Without me even asking, they refunded our money. Good business and seem like nice folks.

Another side note:  We like to arrive and depart from EAST to WEST. the turn is a little tight from the other direction.

name: Barbara Carr
text: Quite place. Really like it here.

name: Daryl Bailes
text: This small cg was okay but not great.  We had 1 of only 5 campers there.  We never could locate the wifi, the grass was up to our knees and the office is unfinished.  But there was a creek to cool us down in the heat of the day and we enjoyed the games they had and there was this cute cat...

name: Nick
text: Vintage camper/glampers do not support this campground they are very judgemental and only like new campers stop making campgrounds like this rich stay away

name: Kathrina Laude
text: Pet friendly family oriented beautiful view

name: Mike and Shawna Hual
text: Great campground with a creek flowing around the grounds.  Quiet with full hookups and good Verizon signal.

name: Joanne Smallwood
text: Beautiful, quiet, peaceful and relaxing! Love this place! Highly recommended staying here!!! We ended up here getting away from Hurricane Michael. We will come back here under better circumstances, tho. This is a nice little getaway spot! Playground for kids...games for adults...nice bathroom/showers. Decent amount of space between campers. Every site has a fire pit, grill and table. The bench swings overlooking the creek are my favorite part!!!!

name: Elaine Armstrong
text: What a wonderful c g. We evacuated from SE Florida and this was our only hope. Paul & Rachel were so helpful and accommodating. Prepared food for all campers for two days. But most of all helped relieve our stress.. We highly recommend this c g for its beautiful location and gracious hospitality.

name: Alexis Lindahl
text: We came to Creekside family campground to escape hurricane Irma. The owners of the campground have been the most friendly, accommodating, helpful people I have ever met. We have two small children and they set up a kids bouncy house, kiddy pool and many activities for the whole family. The site is beautiful, well maintained and very peaceful/relaxing. There is a creek and beach with a lot to do to entertain kids. Creekside family campground has been the most incredible experience and we are so thankful we found this campsite. I highly recommend staying here- If I could give 10+ stars I would!

name: Loving Adoption
text: Beautiful property with a welcoming, family fun feel. Lots for the kiddos to do. Bathrooms are clean and the community porch is inviting. Great place to relax and enjoy time with your loved ones.

name: John Townsend
text: It was great! Our problem is the site has a lot of broken glass! I picked up a good handful & there is still a lot left.

name: Alan Smith
text: This campground is very family friendly. Safe place for the children to play with each other and there also is a playground for the children to play on.

text: Can't say enough good things about Creekside Family Campground!! Just spent 6 days there running from Irma! The McCloud family cooked out all weekend & fed everyone there. Highly recommend & great place If u r traveling with kids. Wonderful little beach & creek to cool off in. We hated to leave, but will surely be back!! Met some wonderful people during our stay!! You gotta go!!!

Will definitely stay here whenever in Mobile

text: Zero amenities, price seemed exorbitant for the region, but they were the only place available when we evacuated due to the hurricane. Woman explained the rate was now higher than the website, not sure if they were price gouging due to the influx of Irma evacuees or not. Neighbors were nice, had obviously been living here for quite some time... This is more of a long term trailer park than an RV resort.

text: I just want to say, we are staying our second full night in this RV Park and we can already tell this place has a really Good vibe. Great Employee's especially Miss Peggy, what a great lady. She has gone out of her way to make sure that were are comfortable. Looking forward too many peaceful days at Bellingrath RV Park.

text: Very accommodating professional management and maintenance personnel.  Family friendly atmosphere.  Clean.  Well kept and safe. Comfortable surroundings.  Recommend to travelers and long term living.

name: Allison Fletcher
text: I have absolutely loved staying here! I have been here for 8 months while attending grad school at the sea lab, and I’ve never had any issues. It’s a nice clean place to stay and the manager, Peggy, is amazing! She is so helpful, welcoming and really cares about the tenants and the park. We have become great friends and she really looks after me. Everyone that works there is friendly and helpful. Summer time is the best time to stay because the pool is beautiful, and management will cookout and make food for everyone. The owner will also make food for the park once a month! I have had some amazing neighbors as well and made new friends. It’s in a great location as well because it’s 15 min to Mobile and 25 min to Dauphin Island. It’s also 4 miles from the beautiful Bellingrath Gardens. Check it out! I highly recommend!

text: Stopped in on our way back from traveling, wanted to visit the Uss Alabama and Bellingrath Gardens. Came in late in the evening, manager was pretty friendly. The pictures on the website were very misleading, the site said free cable, called the office to find out where was the hookup, surprise no cable. The grounds were kind of sketchy, couldn’t wait to leave from there.

name: Chrysa Meyer
text: My husband and I moved out of the park about a year and a half ago, and we were there about 8 months. The only reason we went there was we had a fema camper and no one else accepts them. The owner tried to have us pay $50 extra a month to even keep our small yorkiepoo! Cable is only available if you have a mediacom box but they never stated that when we moved in. My husband had to beg for the WiFi password they advertise as free with moving in, even when we got the password  we only had a small WiFi signal half of the day while the landlord lives it up on the same WiFi. (We believe he changed password that day and never had it again.) The pond they have is full of poo and little life. Neighbors knocked on our door asking for food, money, rides etc. on the regular. Not a safe or happy place at all.  One of the biggest things I disliked about this place is it is a FLOOD PLAIN! That was a huge deal for me using a wheelchair unable to see the light of day for days at a time because the water was too high for my $36,000 powered chair. Oh and when you move in they trick you into letting them keep your security deposit, read the contract and don’t sign until they take away that one condition. All in all this is the worst place in comparison to other RV parks. Don’t pay for a patch of grass and bad neighbors that’s all you’ll ever get for $410 here. Someone report them please.

name: kimberly boyer
text:
1st just let me say.  The photos on Google are wrong. The picture of the industrial building is wrong and I never saw any rats. That is NOT of the bellingrath rv park. The pictures I posted are the real deal.
Also this is a RV PARK. Not a resort or a campground. It is a nice place,  the people who live here are down to earth people.  They are friendly and the staff is helpful.  The owner Mr Dupre and his office manager Peggy were very good to us .  Chris and Bill who work at the park along with a few others.  Worked very hard moving rental campers around to make room for the influx of hurricane Irma evacuees . They also keep the park nice and clean. They have a very nice clean pool which my daughter and I took advantage of.  She's also played with all the children that were here. Needless to say she had a good time playing on the playground and with the other children. Laundry and bath house are clean. About 8 Dollars to wash 3 loads of clothes and dry them. Not bad.  Once again this is a RV park not a resort. People live here. They do have trailers to rent they are dateded.  They have full hookup cable lots of channels. Lots. Disney jr. Football anything you might want to watch.  They are making improvements. Covered concrete slab to park your fifth wheel or diesel pusher. Bus. Or camper. All in all this place was a great place to stay. People are friendly and helpful. My husband, daughter and I will stay here again if we are ever in the area. Also. This RV park is in the middle of everything . The uss Alabama is not far and dauphin park is close also the gulf coast. So listen people if you need a place to stay in a nice clean quiet place to stay for an night, week, month or year check this place out.  Lots of Bang for you buck.

name: Sam Mulcahey
text: Great place. Family friendly. Very clean pool and playground area. Covered paved campsites to park camper. Can accomadate busses and larger rvs. Quiet very clean .  Has laundrymat and bath houses . cable wifi and all the goodies. No loud music ever heard. Has rentals on site.   Dont understand all the bad reviews. Well staffed and willing to help if you have issues.
