name: Jessica Haury
text: Stay clear of this place!!! When you first go in the woman at the desk named jill will try to act really nice and friendly, but she is really not!!! We stayed there for a few days and we got such a weird feeling staying there that we decided to leave and we had already paid them up for a month. We went and told them we wanted to leave that we need our money back and she kept saying she would have to talk to the owner to come back the next day so we did and she kept saying she couldnt get ahold of him and she doesnt have the key to the safe. So she told us to come back the next morning and still she couldnt get ahold of the owner then she ended up getting ahold of him and she started telling my husband that they could give us our money back and that my husband had agreed on $350 and my husband said no i never agreed to that she said yes you did i have it on camera where you did my husband said well roll the tapes back then i wanna see it and of course she didnt do it ! Anyways somehow she still couldnt get the money because the owner couldnt come again to meet us til like the next week i think it was and my husband explained to her that we cant do that that we needed our money back so we could get back home that was a 10 hr drive and that we had no place to go and she said i will go ahead and let you stay a week for free i know the manager will get mad but im gonna do it! Well the manager ended up comin by our camper on a four wheeler and told us to be up there a little bit before the week was over and we would work something out and my husband said ok. Well we went to the office and still he wasnt there to meet us the woman called him texted him... He still wouldnt come to the office to meet so we could talk to him and finally told the woman to get the money out of the safe, but all she gave us was like $300 and said she would send us $50 in the mail and my husband and i told her no that isnt right you owe us like $580 then she said well he says thats what he owes u my husband said no it is more than that we figured it all up on a calculator right in front of her and she said ill tell u what i will give u the $300 now then send you the rest in the mail even if he dissagrees i will get it out of the safe myself and send it to you so we went ahead and agreed cause we were tired of arguing knowing that we are more than likely going to get ripped off but we were so ready to get home that we just did it. Anyways we get home and call her at the time she told us to and of course jill told us oh i wont be able to give u the $50( she owed us like $280 not $50) because we didnt clean the camper before we left which we did she said that is a $40 fee and we had forgot to give them the key before we left so that was a $10 fee and might i add she was laughing as she told my husband this! So my husband told her she would be hearing from our lawyer and hung up the phone. Oh and one more thing i want to add the second time my husband went to the office to try to get the money back he went by hiself and she went off on him when he asked about the money started hollering and screaming at him my husband said mam i am not raising my voice or nothing i am talking ti you calmly and you are being very rude i just want my money back! My husband ended up just walking out and came back to the camper where i was. And the woman acts like she is under the influence of some kind of speed she talks jerks around really fast! Just take this as a warning do not go here! We never got all of our money back we could take them to court, but would cost more money in the long run since we live 10 hrs away!

name: KJ Aubrey
text:
The owner was friendly over the phone at first, but I feel that she could have been more up front about the nature of her place. That would have saved us a wasted 23 mile trip both ways. Waterloo is a beautiful place, but I would rather stay on the free TVA land than at this so-called campground. The campground is actually a trailer park with some spots for camping. We stay in many campgrounds, some better than others, but this is the first time we have driven through a campground and left. I could not even find the camp office to begin with and everybody at the trailer park was staring us down when we drove through.

When I couldn't find the office, I called the owner back to tell her we had changed our minds. She did not answer her phone. I got a phone call later on from a different number and it was the owner. I let her know that her park was not what we expected and that we had changed our minds. She got an attitude with me and said, "Thanks for letting me know. I waited for you for over an hour." I then informed her that I had tried to call and she didn't answer. I did not bother to mention that she wasted an hour of my time and the gas that I used to drive to her disappointment of a trailer park that she is trying to pass off as a campground. If you do decide to camp in Waterloo, I would suggest that you turn right on the road before you cross the bridge into town and stay on the TVA land. It is well maintained, peaceful and it is free.

resp.text: I am sorry that our campground was not what you expected. Our property is 2 businesses, a small campground on the water with bathhouse, boat launch, fishing dock. The main portion are Lake lots that we lease yearly for vacation sites. It's not unusual for people to turn in the wrong drive; I keep meaning to get new signs but since my husband died in March I've been trying to juggle the whole thing alone. After we spoke, I did see that you had called the office number, which is supposed to be transferred to my cell phone. So I called you at 6:10 and we both missed each other. I apologize for my shortness, I have no excuse for that except that 14 hour days, 7 days a week sometimes gets me overwhelmed.   I'm usually pretty nice.  Our campground is usually not full in the fall, and the weather is perfect for camping. If you ever decide to reconsider camping with electric, water , and hot showers, I would be glad to make up to you your "wasted 23 mile round trip". Thank you for your review.

name: Lee Hemming
text: We were greeted by the very helpful and friendly owner. The views are beautiful, however with the description and great reviews, we expected a little more. This is more like a rustic fishing camp. It was recommended that we not use the coffee maker and the microwave at the same time. Yikes! 30 amp service is old. Picnic tables need help. Grass sites. Also there was a dog roaming in the park that was unfriendly, so we didn't feel comfortable having ours out and about. Paid $17 for the night, a fair price, probably. With a few upgrades, this could really be a hidden gem. Grocery and dining not close, so bring what you need.

resp.text: Thank you for staying with us, Mr. Hemming. Your review is pretty accurate, upgrading our electric and some cosmetic work on the tables etc have been in our plans. We actually met with the Utility Company last year , and are still waiting on their approval of the plans . The campground sites were built in the 1970's, and RV requirements have definitely changed since then. We do have some 50amp service, I'm sorry I did not show you those sites. I hope we will be able to get to work on that soon, and that when we do, you will come see us if you ever swing south again!

name: Fred Pearson
text: The most beautiful location,  and the owners and the friendliest people you would ever meet anywhere.

resp.text: Thanks Fred and Darlene!

name: Rich Singh
text: Hart Park is the most wonderful place on Earth. I want to live there, the Hart's are the nicest people and it's a wonderful place to stay visit at once .

resp.text: Thank you, Richard!! Come Back Soon - we miss you!

text: Considering a purchase of a place here, it's looking like it's going to happen! I love the idea of having a waterfront summer place again.

resp.text: Thank you Sheila! We hope you and Rick decide to have your vacation home with us!

Green grassy fields full of cows and horses right outside our RV. It rained for 2 solid days and not a single puddle. The Hester family has a little gem here. Would stay here again and again.

name: Jenny Collette
text: We love this place! We had an awesome lot on the lake that was perfect for weekend getaways. Awesome manager and owner - they are super friendly, easy to work with and wonderful with communication. I can see where parking would be a little tight at when all residents are visiting their campers/places on the lake but it wouldn't be much of a problem as there's overflow parking. Playground for the kids and fishing docks, a volleyball net and basketball hoop. Always clean! We didn't get to experience the game room nor showers as we had our lot during Covid. I'm sure it wouldn't disappoint though! I would recommend this to anyone looking for long term.

name: Charles Thrasher

text: Would give 0 stars if I could..they should change the pics online. We pulled in and right back out, looks like a dump.

resp.text: Wow!  I don't know what you were expecting, but we make no pretensions of being a fancy (or expensive) RV Resort.  We're proud to be an economical, family-oriented campground on a beautiful lake.  Most of our campers leave their RVs here year-round and come up on weekends and vacations.  Some of our campers have been here over ten years.  We leave a few spots open for short-term guests who want to relax on the lake, but if that wasn't for you, we completely understand.  By the way, all of the photos on our website are completely accurate.  My wife took them all!

resp.text:
Laura -- We're glad you enjoy the wildlife around our RV park.  We still occasionally get some deer visit us in the evenings and early mornings.

Hayden

name: John H
text: The worst. A game room advertised but pool table torn to shreds, public bathroom is dirty with feces inside, staff very unprofessional if you can actually find them

resp.text:
Hi John -- Sorry you didn't like our place, but you made some good points.  We've revamped our game room and bathrooms since your last visit in 2017, but we encourage our campers to use the bathrooms in their own RVs and no longer allow tent camping in order to keep our bathrooms cleaner .

Cheers,
Hayden

Hayden

text: Quite country atmosphere. Kept neat and grass cut at least once a week

resp.text: We love to keep our guests happy and our grounds kept! Thanks to David, he makes it all beautiful!!

text: Great RV park, spacious, quiet and you can't beat the location, close to the grocery store in town, and a few good restaurants too. Only about 15 minutes from Dauphin Island!

resp.text: Let us know when you are coming back down. We would to have you!

name: Travis Head
text: We stayed here for a month and it is such a beautiful park! The woman who manages the park is one of the sweetest ladies I have met. So helpful and so kind! She made the stay a whole lot better! It is a quick drive to the island and right down the road from a nice grocery store.

resp.text: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Brian Boland
text: Quiet straight shot to beaches and dauphin island.

resp.text: We have a great place for you!!! Thank you for the kind words!

name: Doug Bevier
text: Needs restrooms. Costly for not having any amenities. Good place for a short stay over.

name: Marta Logan
text:
If your here for fishing and plan on being up early thank Pecan Grove is just fine. But we had a concerning arrival. We did arrive late as we told the lady who took our reservation a 2 weeks prior and the website stayed open until 9 pm. We arrived at 8:45 pm. She answered the phone saying she didn’t have our reservation and that we must have made it somewhere else. But a after giving her multiple details she decided to get dressed and help us find a spot.
We were here on vacation and only spent two nights actually at camp sit the r eat out on neater on boat. Both mornings to be woken up by either a hammer or lawn mower before 7 am. It would have been night to sleep in on vacation.
So if your coming to fish and leaving early it’s perfect, small place and close to water.

resp.text: We sincerely apologize for the headache all of this caused you during your stay. I agree being woken up early on your vacation is not fun. I am thankful you brought this to our attention and have adjusted our labor working hours to better suit our vacationers. As far as the problem you ran into upon arrival we are currently making changes to management operations so we hope to have resolved anything from happening in the future. We hope to see you again in the future.

name: CJ Kay
text: We actually stayed here for a few months a while back. It would be a MUCH nicer place if the guy that runs it wasn't a complete jackass ! Other than that, the neighbors are friendly & it's very peaceful most of time. Oh, if he asks you to pay cash.. MAKE sure he doesn't pocket the money. He has pulled that with a few people the few months we stayed.

resp.text: We apologize you had anything less than pleasant experience while staying with us. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and are currently making changes to our management operations. We are in the process of getting the "Square" system as another option of payment for our tenants and vacationers. We hope you come back and see us.

name: Kris Jensen
text: This is a small RV park with many trees. The staff are friendly and the Wifi is good. Place is a bit rundown. No bathrooms, and the laundry is sub par: one washer and dryer in a shack. The road noise is quite bad. We stayed two nights in a 35 foot fifth wheel.

name: Ron Turner
text: Terrible experience, the owners of this park have entrusted two of their residents to manage the campgrounds. I had a poorly worded threatening note duct taped to my door by “management” during my stay. The less tenants, the happier these folks are. By far the absolute worst experience I have ever had at a campground and I spend probably 80% of the year traveling from camp to camp.

resp.text: I am so sorry it has taken this long to see this and apologize for the terrible experience you had while staying with us. I want to ensure you that we have very recently made changes to our management operations to better make our tenants stay more pleasant. I hope you will give us another opportunity in the future to make your stay a more pleasant one.

name: Michael Bowman
text: Beautiful place. Quite an peaceful. Awsom people will help you with anything. Great accommodations for your money. An a very convenient location to everything in the area.

name: Chad Erickson
text: Nice park. Quiet. Not packed in like alot of parks. Short drive to Dauphin Island and Mobile.

name: Alia
text: Sharon and Mike are absolutely great, they were amazing help over the phone. Sharon informed us that the route Google maps was taking us, would not be accessible for an RV and gave us an alternative route for easy access. Quiet and beautiful little RV park, pet friendly! Definitely the small family business feeling, which is amazing. Will absolutely stay here again if we come back through! PS: I have a flower obsession and Mike and Sharon gave me tons of cool facts about the flowers and trees in the area, even going out of their way to find blooming flowers for me to see.

name: Ruth Hendrix
text: Nice atmosphere, lot parking sizes nice, friendly and easy access.

name: Rob Mason
text: Our stay at Southwood RV Park was great. Mrs. Sharon is a great host. We did not have a 50 to 30amp converter, they loaned us one for the stay. Couldn't ask for more. She also gave us sites visit while we were there. It is a quiet place and safe!

name: Danielle DeVoe
text: When we lost everything during Sally, Ms. Sharon and Mike welcomed us with open arms and a caring shoulder!  It’s so comfortable and peaceful here with occasional pot lucks and a couple games of cornhole!  Couldn’t ask for a better place to be!

name: Tracy Bastien
text: Mike and Sharon do a great job with this RV park, very clean and well-kept. They go out of their way to make sure you’re taken care of. My husband and I work on the road and he tends to be away for several hours in a day. I have an appreciation for a quiet, safe place. The people here are very friendly yet they don’t bother you. I enjoy walking a few miles each day and feel safe while walking in the area as well. The monthly rate is reasonable and includes electric. The Wi-Fi works better than many campgrounds, on occasion I need to use my hotspot for work. We will be back whenever we are in the area.

name: Kyle Ochs
text: Great park with easy access to daupin island as well as dog river.

name: Ron Wooley
text:
One of the best RV parks anywhere in Alabama, and the people there are some of the best.
I stay at different RV Parks 36 weeks each year and this one is a favorite.

name: The Tax Specialist “My Tax Professionals” Rachael Cain-Hilburn
text: This place is the perfect hideaway near Dog River. I love fact it’s within walking distance to the water with great waterfront restaurants, too. Spacious lots and very peaceful. Completely renovated with onsite laundry and some pretty landscaping.  Only a 20-25 minute drive to the beach, as well. The owner is absolutely awesome. I highly recommend this place. I love it.

name: Paul Linendoll
text: Peaceful and quiet it’s like have your own little hideaway the people who own and run this park are absolutely amazing  we are staying for about 3 months and already have plans to come back for  at least 6 more months.Other Rv parks could learn a lot from this place

name: Rae Love
text: I arrived here tonight rving down from Colorado and this place is freaking amazing! The people here are extremely nice and polite and the owner even took time to back my trailer into my spot for me cuz I'm still learning about that. The views around here are gorgeous. The whole vibe here is extremely chill and friendly and just amazing.

name: Shelly Tipton
text: I've been staying at the RV park for a few months now while working. I would definitely recommend. The area is safe, and private, but still close enough to local places to eat and shop. The owners are super, they are involved with everything that goes on and available if you need them.

name: Bryson
text: Was looking to come there and stay for 4 months. The owner comes back with your stickers are faded on your rv, looks like you’ve had water damage, top seals are torn, possible water damage ( which it has been checked out at a local rv dealership, no water issues. But they will not get my money and I will tell everyone I know that camps down there not to give this place a dollar.

name: Mike Faulk
text: Nice, quiet, well maintained RV park. Great owner, takes a real interest in the appearance & maintenance of the park. Great value, easy access to Mobile AL. I highly recommend this park to anyone visiting the Mobile AL area.

name: Christy Dumond
text: Quiet! Love it here! We've been here 3 months & it's home!

name: Robert Airaudi
text: Sharon and Michael are so personalbe and helpful!!!

name: Sharon Cesario
text: Very friendly and helpful

name: Stacey W.
text:
Nice and flat spots to park. Clean. Quiet.  Full hookups. Didn't use the wifi. Close to town. Only stayed one night. Nice people.
Note: It's really new and there are no facilities available (bathrooms, showers or laundry)
Thanks!

name: Matthew Hart
text: If you just need a place to stay for a night or few and don't mind not having facilities then this place is great. The owner is very nice as well and the wifi is good.

name: Erica Yorke
text: Super nice guy that works there and the park is nice and quiet. Fast wifi too. We had a lovely stay.

name: Marilyn Hedstrom
text: Austin went above and beyond he's professional and was helpful with the area.  The food was awesome at the Capitol Oster Bar.   The view was beautiful!  Again Austin was always available and helpful!!

name: ricky duncan
text: Clean water internet power included. Clean property great view

name: Chevy River-Rado
text: I stayed here and had a blast. 5 mins from downtown, great seafood restaurant on the river with live music, and friendly neighbors. The resort has plenty of spaces, is gated, nice and has new everything. They even have boat rentals!! I'll allways be back when I come this way. The staff even helped me with a flat tire. Good honest folks!

name: Stacey Martin
text: Great customer service, super laid back, off the river and a seafood restaurant on site!  The grounds are gravel with grass on outer edges.  We WILL book again if in the area because the customer service was 10 stars.  Gave it 4 stars because all gravel...otherwise, yes please.

name: Tomeka Robinson
text: Such a beautiful friendly place.

name: Susan Greenwood
text: I stayed here and was disappointing... the gravel lot is your parking, no shade, Marina privately owned and it’s very old and decrepit your right next to the rail yard and it is noisy but there is a seafood restaurant next door and looks nice other then that nothing around here . It’s ok if you need a place for the night

name: Ron Maffei
text: Great Quiet campground 5 minutes from downtown Montgomery! This place is new and has a great playground for kids, walking trail to the river and a great seafood restaurant right next door. Gated, secure, large lots available.

name: Mike Lewis
text: Awesome very good host and great great food

name: Samuel Tullis
text: Nice and Spacious!

name: Rob Stevens
text: nice place

name: Debra Mays
text: Time Away RV Resort is awesome. Currently still under construction with a complete hospitable atmosphere.  Anticipating the continuing construction of all the phases.  This place is a great asset to the community at large and should foster other economic growth in Talladega County.  Much more  success!!

resp.text: Thank you for all that you do! We appreciate you! Time Away RV Resort!

name: Queen's Escapades
text:
This RV park is close to the race track. The owners are very friendly and make great host. The park has gravel sites at this time,  a playground and dog walk.   They had a BBQ booth the weekend of the April race and the food was really good. The pool is under construction and will be a big plus once complete!  We look forward to seeing their continued progress.  Reason for 4 stars... Although all the sites are pull through, they are not at an angle,  making for a very sharp turn to get into sites which can be difficult for some Big Rigs like ours, and the sites are very close to each other.  We spent most of our time at the race so these items were not an issue for us.  We will definitely stay here again.

The Queen's Carriage  - Jr & Sharron

resp.text: Thanks so much!

name: Ty Hill
text: Nate and Alicia have done a great job with this premium RV park. We had a great time camping last weekend and really enjoyed the entertainment and all of the people we met. The pull through camp sites make it easy and convenient to setup quickly.

resp.text: Thank you! We can't wait to finish Phase 1! Time Away RV Resort!

name: Janelle Sprowls
text: We stayed for their very first weekend during their grand opening. I had followed their story since the place was a field and was excited to see the progress, was not disappointed, it is a very nice place. The owners will go out of their way to make you feel welcome and your stay pleasant. We are founding members and will be back!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Bruce Williams
text: This place is really coming along. They're working hard for the grand opening. Alicia and her husband gets an A++++. You have to make this one of your stops even if it's a little out the way.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Don Williams
text:
Enjoyed our visit.  The owners were super friendly and very helpful.  They are still making improvements to the property.   It promises to be a very nice campground. It is close to the racetrack and has full hookup.  I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in the area.

Don and Bonnie,  Grenada, MS

resp.text: Thank you!

name: J.C. Foster
text: Up and coming RV park. Great host looking forward to our next trip there.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Melissa Robbins
text: Highly recommend! Full hookups (water pressure is great)! The campground owners were very helpful and gracious. This will be a great get away once they complete the campground. Cannot wait to see it later this yr.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Scott Carpenter
text: Had a wonderful time even with a full day of rain. Will definitely be going back and the 12 hour drive won't stop me

resp.text: Hi Scott! Thanks so much for visiting! We are looking forward to your next visit! Thanks, Time Away RV Resort

name: Andrew Haney
text: Nate and Alicia Lawson have created a little slice of heaven at Time Away. It has been a true blessing to be involved with these wonderful down to earth people. Growing up in the area I know firsthand that Talladega and the surrounding communities have longed for such a place. I'm so excited to see what the future has in store for us all. Keep on keepin on!

resp.text: We are so excited to meet you and your work has been Awesome! Thanks!

name: Laron Perry
text: It was very clean spacious also having  basketball court and other activities for everyone age group and the staff was simply Great and kind I would definitely recommend this Rv resort

resp.text: Thanks Laron!

name: Charles Oldham
text: Ok people it's growing near. What am I talking about? The Grand Opening of Time Away RV Resort in Lincoln, Alabama. This is an event that you don't wanna miss. It's going to be epic. The owners have done a great job of creating something very special. To think that the owners actually gave us RV camping folks a chance to give our input in the making of something so great , is absolutely amazing and shows how much they want their Resort to be one of a kind. If you miss this Grand opening, you will truely miss something spectacular! Thanks to the owners Nathan and Alicia Lawson for all of their hard work , creating a place that we all can take pride in and enjoy.  Thank you much.

resp.text: This should make everyone excited to join us! We am looking forward to meeting you and your family! Thank you so much!

name: Pam Johnston
text: Owners was very friendly.  To be a new full hookup Rv Campground close to the Race Track  is wonderful cant wait to stay again. If you get a chance go check them out.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Marlon Moss
text:
I have to say that it was awesome finally meeting the owners during our stay.  Really proud of them and to see the great work and progress with the continued construction.
The location of the resort was excellent - not far from the Interstate, and a relatively short drive to stores (i.e. Walmart, etc.).
Have been to quite a few RV resorts and honestly some good takeaways and some not so good experiences.  My ONLY criticism was it seemed the sites were a little close to each other, however, the owners made accommodations and created some good spacing for those of us that were reserved in some of the smaller sites.  I also believe that I overheard that the owners were looking to make some improvements as they continue to complete the overall construction.
But again, really inspiring to see this all come together in the way that it is and I will DEFINITELY be back in June for the Grand Opening.
#GreatTimes #GreatOwners #GreatStory2Tell #LastingFriendships #Inspiring #TimeAway

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Mr. E
text: I visited this place and I can not wait to go back. Quiet and no BS there.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: John Cotton
text:
Very new and a work in progress by a couple pouring their heart and sweat in building this RV Resort.
It is a great location to the Talladega Motor Raceway.

resp.text: Thank you John! It’s been a pleasure having you here and we are looking forward to seeing you again! Thanks

name: Jake Wells
text: Super nice owners! Made our stay very pleasant!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Scott Nemecheck
text: Great new resort! Well done.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Carlene Duran
text: It has been fun to watch the construction process of Time Away RV Resort excited for them and can hardly wait for our trip in June!

resp.text: Thanks Carlene! See you soon!

name: Pastor Carmeka T. Benning
text: The owners are kind and professional. They have managed to bring back that community togetherness vibe that existed in the 60's, &70's... trailblazers!

resp.text: Spot on! We are all in this together! Thanks and see you soon!

name: Arlinda Self
text:
This is such an amazing idea and business concept! Thank you for taking us along for your journey and showing us the full process!

You are truly a marriage and partnership!
Keep it going! Can’t wait to come for the Grand Opening June 2021!!

resp.text: Awesome! Thank you for being a part of our journey, Your suggestions happen appreciated! We are looking forward to seeing you at the 2021 Grand Opening Celebration! Thank You! Time Away TV Resort

name: Doris Merriweather
text:
The Owner's of this Resort are wonderful people to have in your life.  You will definitely be pleased at doing business with them.

I can’t wait until the Grand Opening!!!
Congratulations!! God Bless!!!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Carolyn Holt
text: Bates Creek Rv Park is a wonderful place to stay if you are in the area. It has several rv spots which include wifi. This quaint spot is in the country but close enough to stores that it wont take you 5 min to get to town. This rv park also has cabins for rent for very affordable prices. Cabins include wifi and satelight tv. They can include 1 or 2 beds. The 1 bed cabins include a couch and coffee table. The standard micro wave and dorm fridge are also included. There is enough space to really make it a roomy place. Each cabin also has added boot brush to help clean your boots from a hard days work. I love this place and will stay here every time we are this way. Mr Joe, the manager, is friendly and ensures everyone is safe and made welcome here. Ms Angie is one of the sweetest people ive ever had the pleasure of meeting. She will make sure your stay is pleasant and comfortable. For me, this is my new home away from home.

name: Heather Church
text: Great place! My husband, 3 yr old son and i stayed here a year ago and are back again now. Here for about a month each time and as of right now still have had no problems. People running the place are great, very friendly and helpful, genuinely just good people. The cabins are affordable, clean, well taken care of, there is a trailer set up with 2 washers & dryers so laundry is easy... The only drawback id say is that there's no bathtub, only a shower. Not an issue for me but makes life just a little bit more difficult with my toddler.

name: doug mckinney
text:
After 4 months of managing the Bates Creek RV park we have added 15 cabins and RVs for rental along with the RV lots. Several lots are drive thru for our overnight and weekend guest and they all have the 20,30 and 50 amp electrical plugins. Water and ez connect waste. TV WIFI. Being located on highway 43 makes us ez to find and our 2 entrances for North or South travel makes your everyday travel more pleasurable. You can see us Facebook or overhead satellite views on goggle, my Red cabin also is being featured at the lucky duck RV park site and we welcome our friends and guest from our time managing the former Bates Lake park as well. We have good clean shady lots and our oceanless beach front property for parties,sunbathing and just walking around the 63 acres or by the creek.
Thanks and come on down.

name: Cory McCreary
text:
We really enjoyed our two week stay here! Friendly tenants and staff. Quiet at night and spacious, gravel spots. Every site has a fire pit and picnic table. The community areas are great even though they removed the game room due to a fire. Bathrooms and showers are remodeled and clean. The laundry room is in need of an update but there are many  laundromats nearby if needed. Unfortunately, the WiFi is too weak to even connect to. Despite that, we would definitely stay here again.

Just to note, it IS next door to a recycling plant but the noise was not bothersome to us. Also just to be aware, there are factories across the river that sound alarms on Mondays that could be mistaken for emergency alerts but are not.

*** Because the WiFi issue is out of their control, I updated my review to 5 stars instead of 4.

resp.text: Thank you for your generous review.  The laundry room is currently being updated with the addition of more machines.  And yes, we despise the internet issue ourselves.  Unfortunately, we're located in a "non-growth area", so getting service is not possible, or fiscally not viable for our small business.  We're hoping we can get Starlink SOON!

name: Lisa Allred
text: Very impressed with all the improvements done at Jays! So nice!

name: Jessica Parker
text: We stayed here 6 nights and had no internet the entire time. The lady at checkin stated that the company who had contracted to put internet and cable in had reneged on the work. Price per night should reflect lack of amenities stated on website. There is no clubhouse because the main office burned down and they converted the clubhouse into their main office. Neighboring noise from recycling plant during the day was annoying but tolerable. We felt like the price per night should have been between $30-$40 per night compared to other parks we have stayed in. Lake is beautiful and we enjoyed walking along the waters edge.

name: Jim Shrader
text:
We've stayed at Jay Landings twice and were pleasantly surprised by all the updates. Elizabeth, Veronica and the staff are very friendly and were accommodating when we had to change reservations several times due to Covid restrictions.
The campground is clean with amazing views of the Tennessee River. Yes there are lots of full time campers but everyone is respectful and it's quiet at night. And the Sunsets are incredible.
We look forward to going back to one of our Homes away from Home.

name: Clay Baldis
text: Very nice facilities, love having my boat here!

resp.text: Thanks! We love having y’all here!

text: We came to Jay Landing on Super Bowl Saturday for a  3 month stay.  From the minute we arrived Valerie took very GOOD care of us.  On Sunday Joel and Elizabeth the owners threw a SUPERBOWL party worthy of Hollywood and   We met all our neighbors. This is a beautiful campground and Marina located right on the Tennessee River.  We have camped all over this USA and this is one of my favorite places.  EVER!!  I would highly recommend you check it out.   We hope to be back.

resp.text: Thank you, George. We are striving each day to finalize improvements. We hope all goes well with the process of building a new home. What an exciting time!

name: Warner Arthur
text:
we had a great campsite, number 14. Water front and great view. Staff are all great. We did go thru tornado sirens and loud speakers saying to take shelter but I felt there was no place to go. We saw some folks around the bathhouse, but I doubt that would protect much.
The industrial complexes around us were 24/7 noise but inside we did not mind too much.  The paved road into the camp had huge dips and then also speed bumps, which really rocked the RV and the one near the road was so deep we bottomed out the hitch.

name: Linda Gipson
text: Beautiful place to visit for your RV parking or boating family fun

name: Kelvin Tigner
text: Good people and no drama

name: Ruben Moralez
text: Overall this was a nice place to stay, recent upgrades were done to the road and bath houses. The pool was added but like every downside I’m going to mention, you have to pay to get your key pass and be sure not to loose it! The rent is supposed to be set but you’re always charged extra ALWAYS. I ended up paying 100 more every month because I went over my electricity supposedly. Other then paying more every month I’d say it wasn’t a bad stay the management is friendly for the most part I never had any issues with them. The spots are extremely tight and you can pretty much hear everything your neighbor is doing. There are loud noises from the plants around the park especially on the weekends.

resp.text:
Thank you, Ruben, for your reply.  It allows us to provide information to future guests.   I'd like to respond to your "downsides".

Yes, we collect a $20 deposit on the "key pass" to the pool, which is similar to a hotel key to provide safe passageway into the pool for authorized users.  What you failed to mention is that you get that $20 back when you return the key, so you're not out any money.

Secondly, the sites are metered, and tenants are charged .16/kWh for power usage, and one is invoiced anything usage over the $50 allowance.  Anyone is welcomed to monitor their usage by taking note of the meter reading.  It's certainly unfair for a 22' unit to have to pay a higher rent to cover the usage of a 42' unit which has 2 or 3 air conditioner units, therefore, we keep all things even by giving each monthly guest a $50 allowance toward their power.  How they use it is up to the tenant.  You were also here during the summer months when temperatures were extremely high and often record-setting, so yes, you would more than likely have a higher power usage to keep the camper cool.

Thirdly, the site you were on is one of our smaller and cheaper sites.  We have larger sites as well.

Lastly, we are located next to a scrap yard, and they do move scrap around 6 days a week.  Their weekend noise is no different than during the week.  You must have just been off on the weekends to hear it.

And yes, we're continuing to make improvements on the property, including the addition of 21 more sites so we may welcome more guests!

name: Gloria Schulte
text: Nice place. Bathrooms and showers are very clean. Pool is great. Not in great neighborhood but park is gated. Small but you can tell owners try to keep it maintained.

resp.text: Thank you, Gloria. I’d like to clarify. please. The area is safe, it’s just in an industrial area. Safe travels!

name: Carlton Daggett
text: Highly recommend. Friendly staff, Nice pool, Water front Views. No problems with tenants here. I have been staying here for over a month now.

resp.text: Thank you, Carlton!  We are continuing to make improvements, so for you to take the time to post something positive is appreciated!

name: Calista Hans
text: Great customer service! We were met by very friendly Jay Landings greeters as soon as we pulled into the marina who were helpful with all of our questions and getting us unpacked and settled in our boat for a long weekend stay. They also gave us a list of fun things to do and see along the Tennessee River. Bathrooms and facilities were clean and well-lit, and LOTS of great fishing!! We definitely plan on coming back!!

name: Julie Ryan
text:
It's a beautiful places with a lot of recent upgrades. Very nicely recently renovated shower suites, nice pool, beautiful fire pit areas to watch the sunset.

The downsides are that the spots (especially the pullthroughs)are really small and cramped, the road into and through the campground while recently repaved is very narrow, the wifi is terrible, and the bugs are aplenty. We also noticed trash buildup in our sewage receptacle and broken glass all around our site.

Based on older reviews, it appears they are taking steps to really improve the park and we hope that now that they've done some major things they'll take a look at the small things.

We'd also suggest they update their website with correct pricing as the price we were charged was about 25% higher than what their website quotes.

name: Rosemary Swanner
text: We stayed for July 4th holiday. Was a great vacation. The new pool was awesome. And the staff was very nice. Will go back soon.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Rosemary!  We're pleased to hear from you, especially that you enjoyed the pool!

name: Terry Mims
text: Great people. Very easy to deal with.

name: Melissa Flowers
text: I had a great time. If ever in Bama again, I would love to stay here.

resp.text: We would love to welcome your return. Thank you!

name: Loren Gard
text:
Stopped for the night while traveling.  Parked lake front with a great view. When we checked in the guy could not have been nicer. Price was very reasonable.
It was not crowded.

We were offered the free use of kayaks if we wanted.

A great stop over when traveling. Stop short of the 280 space parking lot and have a waterfront wooded lot.

name: David Jones
text:
Beautiful grounds with a peaceful and tranquil setting. Many amenities are close by. The owners are fantastic and treat you like family.

The facilities are spotless and the store is well stocked with boat supplies.

The boat repair service was done right the first time at very reasonable prices.

All in all we love this place and the people.

name: Chris White
text: I stayed here for the week of January 7-12 and it’s a very nice place. The staff is super friendly and helpful. It’s nice and quite plus it’s close to town but you don’t get all of the noise. I had a pretty easy time finding this place and easy to get into I would definitely recommend this place to anyone

name: Debbie L
text: We stayed the Memorial Day weekend here. We drove from Florida. Elizabeth and Joel were amazing hosts. They were extremely helpful and friendly. The park is well maintained. The bathrooms were clean. The price is right and the view was amazing. Definitely will be returning for the 41st Annual Hot Air Balloon Festival and will stay at Jay's Landing and Marina. I already have my reservation made.

name: Sher Keb
text:
Very similar to roughing it by the river with electric, water and sewer.

Regardless of anything (State or personal emergencies), reservations not cancelled 7 days in advance are not refundable where other campgrounds did give us a refund due to a state declared emergency. On May 27, 2018 when “The governors of Alabama, Florida and Mississippi declared a state of emergency in their states as Subtropical Storm Alberto spread north and west.
As for a overall review of Jay’s Landing in Decatur Alabama, see below:

Con’s:
-Interface with management done only by phone. Reservation, check-in & problem resolution.
-400 feet of very pot holed narrow driveway. Many potholes in little bit of asphalt then much more potholes in the more clay than gravel drive. (Very muddy when it rains)
-More long term “campers” in the park then recreational RV campers
-Paper litter, cigarette butts, nut & bolts, metal scraps found on camp sites.
-Bathroom & shower building is far from camping sites
-Sites are close to each other
-No fishing allowed.

Pro’s
- 2 unisex bathrooms & showers were clean
-Site utilities (electric, water & sewer) are convenient. Electric 30 amp circuit showed good connection and grounding.
-Reservation email sent with a site map document with your site.
-Picnic tables at each site.
-Nice river view
'Common area gazebo with a fire pit and a little playground.

Has the makings of a nice RV park… Someday

name: Dannyy Thompson
text: Nice views and good for families

name: millie boyken

A & C King

Suzie & Darrell

text: Stayed for 2 nights with family.   This is in the middle of an industrial complex and felt like it is in a run down part of town.  Factory noise all the time.   The metal recycling yard is across the road.   Bathrooms are far away and pretty dirty.  Not to far from interstate.  Many long term campers.  Definantly not worth the amount we paid.  We stayed in site 14 on the water.

text: Easy access to US-72 and nice location, especially if you have a boat and are looking for access to the river or an overnight stop between Atlanta and Memphis. The Wi-Fi seemed fine, and the laundry facilities were clean (although we didn't use them). The only recommendation is that they fill in some of the potholes on the drive in, as it's a little rough.

name: Nancy Brown
text:
Shower area could have been cleaner
Park and view on general was a nice view and peaceful setting.
Staff was very friendly and nice and kid friendly.

resp.text: Please come back!  Yes, our bath house was in a “low standard” condition, but they have undergone renovation and are now stunning!!!

name: Renee Conway
text: We went with all intentions of only staying a week to 10 days and enjoyed the camp site so well that we stayed for a month. Love the owners and employees are all so helpful and care about their property

name: Jose Noway
text: Might as well stay in a crackhouse. This place is just as dirty and has similar amenities. Only difference is the price.

resp.text:
Mr. Stimpson, are you the owner of “The Other Woman”?  I’m not aware of another John/Jon Stimpson.

Can you expound on what’s “dirty”?  If you’re referencing dusty, you are absolutely correct in referencing our previous state. However, we are undergoing major improvements and paving, which you wouldn’t know about since you haven’t been on the property nor a tenant in a year or so.

If this isn’t the same Mr. Stimpson, then please accept my apology, and will you further explain?

name: Faye Holt
text: Sun set at Jay's landing

name: Dustin Pannell
text: Good place nice ppl working nights very respectful... they tryed not doing thing around my camper while I was sleeping waited for me to get up and go to work first!!!!!

name: Thomas Schmelzle
text: Was a decent place to stay for a night.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Ronald Wojtylko
text: Tight RV spaces, lousy internet.  Worst thing nay be that it is right next to SA recycling so at 6 am, the noise level gets quite high.  Place is a construction worker cash grab.

resp.text: Yes; some spaces are tight, but not all.  Yes, there is a recycling plant next door, and there are times when it is very noisy.  It makes me sad that you say we are a "construction worker cash grab".  We are in business to provide a nice place for "construction worker(s)", and when I have to turn someone down because we are full due to all of the work in the area, we feel badly that we cannot provide a safe environment for such wonderful tenants.  You haven't been here in awhile.  Please come back.  We are in the middle of major property improvements, and we'd like to think that you'd enjoy your next stay.

name: chris corso
text: We stayed for a night coming home from vacation and it was wonderful.  The facilities were very clean and the owners (who took over a few years back) keep the place ship shape and very pleasant.  This rv park/marina is surrounded by a lot of industry  but, this did not keep us from enjoying ourselves in the time we were there.  We had a great time checking out the giant old boats, chickens, playing basketball, and playing with the giant chess set and jenga.  This is not a traditional rv park with wooded surroundings, but we thought it was just great, and if we had brought our boat or fishing poles, we would have loved it even more as it is surrounded on 2 sides by water.  Recommend.

The owners of this RV Park were gracious to let me stay here for Hurricane Dorian.
I was a refugee from Savannah and didn’t want to leave my camper there not knowing where Dorian would hit in Georgia.
I called and they graciously let me stay during the hurricane free of charge!
I can’t say thank you enough.
These are good people and I was blessed by them.
The park is great, clean, and quiet.
I highly recommend it.

text: I think the maintenance guy needs to mind his own business and do his job instead of harassing paying customers

resp.text:
Hello Shane,

We take pride in our park and make sure not to harass any customers during their time here. We do not allow any primitive camping in our park and do not allow tents. Our employees make sure all rules are followed for the well-being,quietness and cleanliness of our park. You arrived with your boss with the spring fling fair and pitched a tent in the back of our park without permission and had several complaints. We politely asked that you remove the tent you had pitched behind our storage building.

If you would like to give us any further feedback of your stay, please give our office a call at (334)-298-7503.

Thanks,
Sawyer's Mobile Home Estates & RV Park

name: Marylou King
text: I was quite disappointed in the place, considering the reviews.  But I think most of the reviews are based on the mobile home park rather than the RV park.  It’s a mobile home park, which I was aware of, with a few spaces for RV’s.  What was most dissatisfying, considering it was $35.00 a night, was that there was no bathhouse or laundry and no WiFi or cable, because the cable was broken at our site.  The site was level and we had no problem in length for our 30 ft. motorhome, car dolly, and car.  We only stayed for one night, so it was doable, but I won’t want to stay longer.

resp.text:
Thank you for your constructive feedback of our park. We are sorry that you did not have a excellent experience with our park. We do have over 60 RV sites and unfortunately cable does mess up sometimes, but we would be happy to accommodate for that trouble.  We are constantly looking for ways to improve upon our guest experience and welcome to any suggestions.  Do not hesitate to contact us at your earliest convenience if you would like to discuss this in further detail.

Thanks again for choosing Sawyer's Mobile Home Estates & RV Park

text: Camp Chula Vista is amazing! The directors and counselors are full of God's spirit and love. The camp really works hard to pour that spirit and love into everyone. The daily structure of activities and games gives everyone something to look forward to. Friendships grow stronger, as kids work together through the week. That same friendship lasts through the year, as kids look forward to seeing each other again. You can't find a better place to be with God, than at this church camp.

text: Such a beautiful place to disconnect from the world and recharge. The new beds sleep great at their hotel. They have so much to offer here. Canoeing, hiking, biking, sometimes even horses. A beautiful lake

text: Camp Chula Vista has offered amazing experiences for my children for many years while they have grown up attending the summer camps.  My oldest daughter had her wedding rehearsal in the CRC and we used the hotel rooms for our guests.  The staff is amazing and I couldn't say enough good things about this camp. It was very clean and orderly.  The rehearsal meal was catered by Camp Chula Vista and was simply delicious.  My children always come home talking about the wonderful food that is served at the summer camps.  God is always the focus at Camp Chula Vista and continues to bless it.

resp.text: Thanks for your review.  We are glad your family continues to come enjoy God's beautiful view at Camp Chula Vista.

text: I'm torn, there wasn't much communication from camp staff, called and text. Host was drunk the first night, so we didn't get the wood we paid ahead for until the next day. We will be back again, but we'll just bring our own wood.

name: Lilly Ray
text:
Great fishing and boat.
This is a new post.
My husband and i enjoyed going to the pavilion at live oak to eat lunch. On our last visit there were so many ducks. We went into the pavilion and there was so much duck poop you couldn't sit and the duckes were flying into it. We had to leave. Not going back. Don't even think about fishing. They follow you around. Disgusting. Need to be gone. We will not return bc of these nasty ducks flying around you trying to eat or fish.

resp.text: Lilly Ray we Thank you for the feedback. We are sorry to hear that your experience with Live Oak Landing wasn't up to par. Our staff has thoroughly trying to fix those issues !

text: A beautiful area, the trees are gorgeous! The young man who is currently serving as camp host was very pleasant and accommodating. However, upon our arrival, it wasn't very clear how to actually check-in. It was mid-afternoon on a Friday and the onsite General Store was closed. There was a sign on the door with a phone number so I called that and we were told to find a site and the camp host would arrive shortly. We stayed in the tent camping section for 3 nights, total cost was $66. Unfortunately the nearest outhouse was quite a walk from our site and we were only about halfway back into the camping area. I've been camping for 34 years and I don't think I have ever had to walk that far to use a bathroom. We had to drive to the bathhouse for showers because it's even farther than the outhouses and it's partway down a 25 mph road without sidewalks. While the bathhouse was pretty clean, the mini trash cans were not emptied the entire time we were there and with only one shower in each of the men/women's bathrooms, we often had to wait in lines with 2 or 3 people ahead of us. There's a great boat launch which was being utilized for a fishing tournament qualifying event the weekend we stayed so there was a ton of trucks/trailers coming and going and when we left in our car for a trip to town, we were blocked into the tent area by trucks lined up to pull their boats out of the water. There are signs posted not to block the road, and I realize how difficult it would be to enforce it, but I would recommend anyone planning to stay to check if similar events might be held and avoid the park at those times. Also, for some strange reason the tent area road was blocked off in several places by rope so we had to kind of forge our own way in some places which concerned me since I don't have a 4-wheel drive vehicle.  I think overall it's a really great campground, we felt isolated from other campers and our site was beautifully situated in the shade on a bluff above Tensaw River. The bugs were kind of bad but that was expected, we were prepared with bug spray. We also kept a smoky fire burning which helped.  I would love to see an outhouse placed in the middle of the tent area since the closest one was at the boat launch. I also recommend adding a map of the grounds to your website. We'd stay here again if there was an outhouse added to the tent area; otherwise, we probably won't come back which sucks because it's really beautiful. We really did enjoy ourselves, though.
